They hardened their hearts from time to time and spoke against Moses and against God. Still, you know that they were led by His unmatched power into the promised land.

Now, after all these things, the time has come that they have become wicked, almost completely; and I don't know but that today they are about to be destroyed. I know that the day will surely come when they must be destroyed, except for a few who will be taken into captivity.
So the Lord commanded my father to leave and go into the wilderness. The Jews also tried to kill him, and you have tried to take his life too. You are murderers in your hearts and just like them.

You are quick to do evil but slow to remember the Lord your God. You have seen an angel, and he spoke to you; you have heard his voice from time to time, and he has spoken to you in a still, small voice, but you were past feeling and could not feel his words. So he has spoken to you with a voice like thunder, which caused the earth to shake as if it were about to split apart.

You also know that by the power of his almighty word he can cause the earth to pass away, and you know that by his word he can make rough places smooth, and smooth places break apart. So why are your hearts so hard?
My soul is torn with anguish because of you, and my heart is in pain; I'm afraid you'll be cast off forever. I am so full of the Spirit of God that my body has no strength.

After I spoke these words, they became angry with me and wanted to throw me into the depths of the sea. As they came forward to grab me, I said to them, "In the name of the Almighty God, I command you not to touch me, for I am filled with the power of God, even to the consuming of my flesh. Whoever lays a hand on me will wither like a dried reed and will be nothing before the power of God, for God will strike him."
I, Nephi, told them not to complain against their father anymore and not to refuse to help me, because God had commanded me to build a ship.
I told them, if God commanded me to do anything, I could do it. If he told me to say to this water, "Become earth, " it would become earth; and if I said it, it would happen.
And now, if the Lord has such great power and has performed so many miracles among the children of men, how can you say that he cannot instruct me to build a ship?

I, Nephi, said many things to my brothers, so much that they were confused and couldn't argue with me; they didn't dare lay their hands on me or even touch me with their fingers for many days. They didn't dare because they were afraid they would wither in front of me, the Spirit of God was so powerful; and that's how it affected them.

The Lord said to me, "Stretch out your hand again toward your brothers, and they will not wither in front of you, but I will shock them. I am doing this so they will know that I am the Lord their God."
I stretched out my hand toward my brothers, and they didn't wither in front of me; but the Lord shook them, just as he had said he would.

They said, "We know for sure that the Lord is with you, because we know it's the power of the Lord that has shaken us." They fell down before me and were about to worship me, but I wouldn't allow it. I said, "I am your brother, your younger brother. Worship the Lord your God, and honor your father and your mother so that your days may be long in the land the Lord your God will give you."
They worshiped the Lord and went with me, and we worked timbers with remarkable skill. The Lord showed me from time to time how I should work the timbers of the ship.
I, Nephi, didn't shape the wood or build the ship the way people usually do. Instead, I built it the way the Lord showed me, so it wasn't made like other ships.
I, Nephi, often went up into the mountain and frequently prayed to the Lord, and the Lord showed me great things.
After I finished the ship, following the word of the Lord, my brothers saw that it was good and that its workmanship was extremely fine. They humbled themselves again before the Lord.
The voice of the Lord came to my father, telling us to get up and go down into the ship.

The next day, after we had prepared everything—plenty of fruit and meat from the wilderness, lots of honey, and all the supplies the Lord had commanded us to gather—we went down into the ship with all our cargo, our seeds, and everything we had brought with us, each person according to their age. So we all went down into the ship with our wives and our children.
Now, my father had two sons while we were in the wilderness; the older was named Jacob and the younger was named Joseph.
After we had all gone into the ship and brought our supplies and everything we had been commanded to take, we set out to sea and were carried by the wind toward the promised land.

After we had been driven by the wind for many days, my brothers, the sons of Ishmael, and their wives started to celebrate. They began to dance, sing, and speak very rudely, even forgetting by what power they had been brought there. They became extremely disrespectful.

I, Nephi, became very afraid that the Lord would be angry with us and punish us for our sins by causing us to be swallowed up in the depths of the sea. So I began to speak to them very seriously, but they were angry with me and said, "We don't want our younger brother to rule over us."
Laman and Lemuel took me and tied me up with cords, treating me very harshly. However, the Lord allowed it so he could show his power and fulfill the word he had spoken about the wicked.
After they tied me up so tightly that I couldn't move, the compass that the Lord had prepared stopped working.

They didn't know which way to steer the ship, so a great and terrible storm arose, and we were driven back on the water for three days. They became extremely afraid that they might drown in the sea, but they still didn't release me.
On the fourth day that we had been driven back, the storm became extremely severe.

We were about to be swallowed up in the depths of the sea. After we had been driven back on the water for four days, my brothers began to realize that God's judgments were upon them, and that they would die unless they repented of their sins. So they came to me and loosened the bands on my wrists, which had become extremely swollen; my ankles were also very swollen, and they were very sore.
Still, I looked to my God and praised Him all day long, and I didn't complain to the Lord because of my troubles.

My father, Lehi, had said many things to them and also to the sons of Ishmael; but they threatened anyone who tried to speak for me. My parents, being old and having suffered much grief because of their children, became so distressed that they ended up bedridden with sickness.

Because of their grief and deep sorrow, and because of the wickedness of my brothers, they were close to dying and meeting their God; their gray hairs were about to be brought down to the grave; they were nearly taken with sorrow into a watery grave.

Jacob and Joseph, who were young and needed a lot of care, were upset because of their mother's suffering; and even though my wife pleaded with tears and prayers, and my children also tried, my brothers' hearts were not softened enough to let me go.

Only the power of God, which threatened them with destruction, could soften their hearts. When they saw that they were about to be swallowed up in the depths of the sea, they repented of what they had done and released me.
After they freed me, I took the compass, and it worked the way I wanted it to. I prayed to the Lord, and after I prayed, the winds stopped, the storm ended, and there was a great calm.
I, Nephi, guided the ship, and we sailed again toward the promised land.
After we had sailed for many days, we arrived at the promised land. We went out onto the land, set up our tents, and called it the promised land.
We began to till the earth and plant seeds, putting all the seeds we had brought from Jerusalem into the ground. They grew extremely well, and we were blessed with abundance.

As we traveled in the wilderness and arrived in the promised land, we found animals of every kind in the forests—cows, oxen, donkeys, horses, goats, wild goats, and all sorts of wild animals that could be used by people. We also found all kinds of ore, including gold, silver, and copper.

The Lord commanded me, so I made plates of metal to record the history of my people. On the plates I made, I engraved the record of my father, our travels in the wilderness, my father's prophecies, and many of my own prophecies.

I didn't know when I made them that the Lord would command me to make these plates. So, the record of my father, the genealogy of his ancestors, and most of what happened to us in the wilderness are engraved on those first plates I mentioned. That's why the events that happened before I made these plates are described in more detail on the first plates.

After I made these plates because I was commanded to, I, Nephi, received a commandment that the ministry and the prophecies—the more plain and precious parts—should be written on these plates, and that what was written should be kept to teach my people, who would live in the land, and also for other wise purposes, which are known to the Lord.

So I, Nephi, made a record on the other plates, which gives a more detailed account of the wars, conflicts, and destructions among my people. I have done this and instructed my people on what to do after I am gone, so that these plates will be passed down from one generation to another, or from one prophet to another, until the Lord gives further commandments.
I will give an account of how I made these plates later, and now I continue as I have said. I do this so that the more sacred things can be preserved for my people's knowledge.

Still, I don't write anything on the plates unless I believe it's sacred. And if I make mistakes, others in the past have made mistakes too; not that I'm trying to excuse myself because of others, but because of my own weakness as a human, I ask to be excused.

The things that some people consider very valuable, both for the body and the soul, others ignore and treat as worthless. Even the God of Israel is treated this way; people ignore him and do not listen to his guidance.
He will come, as the angel said, six hundred years after my father left Jerusalem.

And the world, because of their wickedness, will consider him to be worthless; so they will whip him, and he will endure it; they will strike him, and he will endure it. They will spit on him, and he will endure it, because of his loving kindness and his patience toward the children of men.

The God of our fathers, who led them out of Egypt and out of bondage, and who also preserved them in the wilderness—the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—will give himself, as the angel said, as a man into the hands of wicked men, to be lifted up as Zenock said, to be crucified as Neum said, and to be buried in a tomb as Zenos said concerning the three days of darkness, which will be a sign of his death to those living on the islands of the sea, especially to those who are of the house of Israel.

The prophet said: The Lord God will surely visit all the house of Israel on that day—some with his voice, because of their righteousness, bringing them great joy and salvation, and others with the thunder and lightning of his power, by storms, by fire, by smoke, vapor of darkness, the opening of the earth, and by mountains being lifted up.

All these things will surely happen, says the prophet Zenos. The rocks of the earth will break apart, and because of the groanings of the earth, many of the kings of the islands of the sea will be influenced by the Spirit of God to exclaim, "The God of nature is suffering."

As for those who are in Jerusalem, the prophet says they will be punished by all people because they crucify the God of Israel and turn their hearts away, rejecting signs, wonders, and the power and glory of the God of Israel.

Because they turn their hearts away and have rejected the Holy One of Israel, the prophet says they will wander in the flesh, perish, become an object of scorn and a byword, and be hated among all nations.
However, when that day comes, says the prophet, that they no longer turn their hearts against the Holy One of Israel, then he will remember the covenants he made with their fathers.

Then he will remember the islands of the sea, and I will gather in all the people who are of the house of Israel, says the Lord, according to the words of the prophet Zenos, from the four corners of the earth.
All the earth will see the salvation of the Lord, says the prophet; every nation, kindred, language, and people will be blessed.
I, Nephi, have written these things to my people, hoping I might persuade them to remember the Lord, their Redeemer.
I speak to all the house of Israel, in case they receive these things.

I have feelings in the Spirit that tire me so much that all my joints feel weak, because of those who are in Jerusalem. If the Lord had not been merciful and shown me things about them, just as he did for prophets of old, I would have perished too.
He definitely showed the prophets of old everything about them, and he also showed many things about us. So, we need to know about them, because these things are written on the brass plates.
I, Nephi, taught my brothers these things and read many passages to them from the plates of brass, so they could learn about what the Lord had done in other lands among people in ancient times.

I read many things to them that were written in the books of Moses. But to help persuade them more fully to believe in the Lord their Redeemer, I also read to them what was written by the prophet Isaiah. I compared all scriptures to our own lives so that it would benefit us and help us learn.

So I spoke to them, saying: Listen to the words of the prophet, you who are a remnant of the house of Israel, a branch that has been broken off; listen to the words of the prophet, which were written to all the house of Israel, and apply them to yourselves, so that you may have hope just like your brothers from whom you have been separated, because this is how the prophet wrote.

Listen to this, house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel and have come from the waters of Judah, or from the waters of baptism. You swear by the name of the Lord and talk about the God of Israel, but you do not swear in truth or in righteousness.
They call themselves part of the holy city, but they do not rely on the God of Israel, who is the Lord of Hosts; the Lord of Hosts is his name.
I have declared the former things from the beginning; they came from my mouth, and I showed them. I revealed them suddenly.
I did this because I knew you are stubborn, with a neck like iron and a forehead like bronze.
I have told you from the beginning; before it happened I showed them to you. I did this so you wouldn't say, "My idol did this, my carved image and my metal image commanded these things."
You have seen and heard all this; will you not declare it? I have shown you new things from this time—hidden things that you did not know.
They have been created now and not from the beginning; even before the day when you heard them, they were declared to you, so that you wouldn't say, "I already knew them."
You didn't listen; you didn't know; from that time your ear wasn't opened. I knew you would act very treacherously and were called a transgressor from birth.
But for my name's sake I will hold back my anger, and for my praise I will restrain myself from you, so that I do not cut you off.
I have refined you; I have chosen you in the furnace of affliction.
For my own sake, for my own sake I will do this, because I will not allow my name to be dishonored, and I will not give my glory to anyone else.
Listen to me, Jacob, and Israel whom I have called, for I am he; I am the first, and I am also the last.
My hand has also laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand has stretched out the heavens. I call to them and they stand together.

Everyone, gather and listen. Who among them has announced these things to them? The Lord has loved him, and he will fulfill his word that he has spoken through them. He will carry out his will against Babylon, and his power will come upon the Chaldeans.
The Lord says: I, the Lord, have spoken; I have called him to declare, I have brought him, and he will make his way successful.
Come near to me; I have not spoken in secret. From the beginning, from the time it was declared, I have spoken. The Lord God and his Spirit have sent me.
This is what the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel, says: I have sent him—the Lord your God who teaches you to benefit and leads you in the way you should go has done this.
If only you had listened to my commandments—then your peace would have been like a river, and your righteousness like the waves of the sea.
Your descendants would have been as numerous as the sand, and your children as countless as its gravel; his name would not have been cut off or destroyed from my presence.
Leave Babylon, escape from the Chaldeans. Proclaim this with joyful singing; announce it to the ends of the earth. Say, "The Lord has redeemed his servant Jacob."
They didn't get thirsty; he led them through the deserts and made water flow out of the rock for them. He split the rock, and water gushed out.
Even though he has done all this, and even greater things, there is no peace for the wicked, says the Lord.

Listen, house of Israel, all of you who are broken off and driven out because of the wickedness of the leaders of my people—all of you who are scattered abroad, who are my people, house of Israel. Listen to me, you distant lands, and pay attention, you people far away. The Lord has called me from the womb; he mentioned my name while I was still in my mother's womb.
He has made my words as sharp as a sword; he has hidden me in the shadow of his hand, and made me like a polished arrow; he has kept me hidden in his quiver.
He said to me, "You are my servant, O Israel, in whom I will be glorified."
Then I said, I have worked for nothing, I have used my strength for no purpose and in vain; but my judgment is with the Lord, and my work is with my God.

And now, the Lord says—who formed me from the womb to be his servant, to bring Jacob back to him—even if Israel is not gathered, I will still be glorious in the eyes of the Lord, and my God will be my strength.

He said: It is a small thing for you to be my servant to restore the tribes of Jacob and bring back those of Israel who have been preserved. I will also make you a light to the Gentiles, so that you may bring my salvation to the ends of the earth.

The Lord, the Redeemer of Israel and His Holy One, says to the one despised by people and hated by the nation, the servant of rulers: Kings will see and stand, and princes will bow down, because the Lord is faithful.

The Lord says: At a favorable time I have heard you, O islands of the sea, and on a day of salvation I have helped you; I will protect you and give you my servant as a covenant for the people, to establish the land and to help them inherit the desolate inheritances.
You will say to the prisoners, "Go free, " and to those sitting in darkness, "Show yourselves." They will find food along the roads, and their pastures will be on every high place.
They will not hunger or thirst, and the heat or the sun will not strike them; for the one who has mercy on them will lead them, and he will guide them by springs of water.
I will turn all my mountains into roads, and my highways will be raised up.
House of Israel, these will come from far away; some from the north and from the west, and others from the land of Sinim.

Sing, heavens, and be joyful, earth, for the feet of those who are in the east will be established. Break out into singing, mountains, for they will not be struck anymore. The Lord has comforted his people and will have mercy on those who are afflicted.
But Zion has said, "The Lord has abandoned me, and my Lord has forgotten me"—but he will show that he has not.
Can a woman forget her nursing child, so that she would not have compassion on the son she gave birth to? They might forget, but I will not forget you, O house of Israel.
I have engraved you on the palms of my hands; your walls are always before me.
Your children will hurry back, and those who destroyed you will leave you.

Look around you and see; all these people are gathering together and will come to you. As surely as I live, says the Lord, you will clothe yourself with them all like an ornament and wear them like a bride.
Your ruined and deserted places, and the land that was destroyed, will now be too small because of the number of people living there, and those who once conquered you will be far away.
The children you have after losing the first will say to you, "This place is too small for me; give me space so I can live here."

You will say in your heart, "Who gave me these children, since I have lost my own and am desolate, a captive, wandering back and forth? Who raised these for me? I was left alone—where did these come from?"
The Lord God says: I will raise my hand to the Gentiles and set up my standard for the people; they will bring your sons in their arms, and your daughters will be carried on their shoulders.

Kings will be your guardians, and their queens will care for you. They will bow down to you with their faces to the ground and show deep respect at your feet. Then you will know that I am the Lord, and those who wait for me will not be ashamed.
Can the prey be taken from the mighty, or can lawful captives be set free?
The Lord says: Even the captives of the mighty will be taken away, and the prey of the terrible will be delivered. I will fight against those who fight against you, and I will save your children.

I will make those who oppress you eat their own flesh; they will be drunk on their own blood as if it were sweet wine. Then everyone will know that I, the Lord, am your Savior and Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

After I, Nephi, had read these things engraved on the brass plates, my brothers came to me and asked, "What do these things you have read mean? Are they meant to be understood spiritually, as things that will happen by the spirit and not in a physical way?"
And I, Nephi, said to them: They were shown to the prophet by the voice of the Spirit, because the Spirit makes all things known to the prophets that will happen to the children of men in the flesh.
The things I have read are about both temporal and spiritual matters, because it seems that the house of Israel will eventually be scattered across the entire earth and among all nations.

There are many who are already lost from the knowledge of those in Jerusalem. Most of the tribes have been taken away and are scattered across the islands of the sea. None of us knows where they are, except that we know they have been led away.

Since they have been led away, these things have been prophesied about them, and also about all those who will later be scattered and confused because of the Holy One of Israel; for they will harden their hearts against him, so they will be scattered among all nations and will be hated by everyone.

After they are cared for by the Gentiles, and the Lord has lifted his hand over the Gentiles and made them a standard, and their children have been carried in their arms and their daughters on their shoulders, these things being spoken of are physical; because the Lord's covenants with our fathers apply to us in the future, as well as to all our brothers who are of the house of Israel.

It means that after all the house of Israel has been scattered and confused, the Lord God will raise up a mighty nation among the Gentiles, even on this land; and through them our descendants will be scattered.

After our descendants are scattered, the Lord God will begin a marvelous work among the Gentiles, which will be of great value to our descendants. It is compared to them being nourished by the Gentiles and carried in their arms and on their shoulders.

It will also be valuable to the Gentiles, and not only to them but to all the house of Israel, to make known the covenants of the Father in heaven to Abraham, saying: Through your descendants all the families of the earth will be blessed.
I want you to know, my brothers, that all the families of the earth cannot be blessed unless he reveals his power to the nations.
So the Lord God will show his power to all nations by fulfilling his covenants and bringing his gospel to those who are of the house of Israel.

He will bring them out of captivity, and they will be gathered to the lands of their inheritance; they will be brought out of obscurity and darkness, and they will know that the Lord is their Savior and Redeemer, the Mighty One of Israel.

The blood of that great and abominable church, which is the whore of all the earth, will come back on their own heads. They will fight among themselves, and their own swords will turn against them. They will be drunk with their own blood.

Every nation that goes to war against you, O house of Israel, will turn against each other, and they will fall into the pit they dug to trap the people of the Lord. All who fight against Zion will be destroyed, and that great whore who has corrupted the right ways of the Lord, that great and abominable church, will collapse to the dust, and its fall will be great.

The prophet says that the time is coming soon when Satan will no longer have power over the hearts of people. The day is approaching when all the proud and those who do wicked things will be like stubble, and they will have to be burned.
The time is coming soon when the full wrath of God will be poured out on all people, because he will not allow the wicked to destroy the righteous.

He will preserve the righteous by his power, even if the fullness of his wrath must come and the righteous are preserved, even to the destruction of their enemies by fire. The righteous do not need to be afraid, for the prophet says they will be saved, even if it is as by fire.

My brothers, I tell you that these things must happen soon—blood, fire, and vapor of smoke will come upon the face of this earth. These things will come to people in the flesh if they harden their hearts against the Holy One of Israel.
The righteous will not be destroyed, because the time will surely come when everyone who fights against Zion will be cut off.

The Lord will definitely prepare a way for his people to fulfill the words of Moses, who said, "The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you, like me; you must listen to everything he tells you. Anyone who does not listen to that prophet will be separated from the people."
Now I, Nephi, tell you that the prophet Moses spoke about was the Holy One of Israel; he will judge with righteousness.

The righteous don't need to be afraid, because they won't be put to shame. But the kingdom of the devil will be built up among the children of men, and that kingdom is established among those who are in the flesh—

The time will soon come when all churches that are built to make money, those built to gain power over others, those built to become popular in the eyes of the world, and those who seek the desires of the flesh and worldly things and do all kinds of evil—everyone who belongs to the kingdom of the devil—are the ones who need to fear, tremble, and shake. They will be brought low to the dust and will be consumed like stubble. This is according to the words of the prophet.
Very soon, the righteous will be cared for like calves in a stall, and the Holy One of Israel will reign with dominion, might, power, and great glory.
He gathers his children from the four corners of the earth; he counts his sheep, and they know him. There will be one fold and one shepherd. He will feed his sheep, and they will find pasture in him.
Because his people are righteous, Satan has no power; he cannot be released for many years, because he has no power over their hearts. They live righteously, and the Holy One of Israel reigns.
Now I, Nephi, tell you that all these things must happen in this life.
All nations, families, languages, and people will live safely in the Holy One of Israel if they are willing to repent.
Now I, Nephi, will stop here, because I do not dare to say more about these things right now.
My brothers, I want you to consider that the things written on the brass plates are true, and they testify that a person must be obedient to God's commandments.

You don't need to think that my father and I are the only ones who have testified and taught them. If you obey the commandments and endure to the end, you will be saved on the last day. That's how it is. Amen.
After I, Nephi, finished teaching my brothers, our father Lehi also spoke to them and reminded them of the great things the Lord had done for them in bringing them out of Jerusalem.
He spoke to them about their rebellions while they were on the water, and about God's mercy in saving their lives so they were not swallowed up by the sea.
He also spoke to them about the promised land they had received, and how merciful the Lord had been in warning them to leave Jerusalem.
He said, "I have seen a vision, and I know that Jerusalem is destroyed. If we had stayed in Jerusalem, we would have died too."

He said that despite our hardships, we have received a promised land—a land that is better than any other. The Lord God has promised me that this land will be an inheritance for my descendants. The Lord has made this covenant with me and my children forever, and also with all those who are brought here from other countries by the Lord's guidance.
I, Lehi, prophesy by the power of the Spirit within me that no one will come to this land unless they are brought by the hand of the Lord.

This land is set apart for those whom God brings here. If they serve Him according to the commandments He has given, it will be a land of freedom for them, and they will never be brought into captivity. If they are, it will be because of their wickedness; for if wickedness becomes widespread, the land will be cursed for their sake, but it will always be blessed for the righteous.
It is wise that this land should still be kept unknown to other nations, because many nations would overrun it and there would be no place left for an inheritance.

I, Lehi, have received a promise that as long as those whom the Lord God brings out of Jerusalem keep His commandments, they will prosper in this land. They will be kept separate from all other nations so they can possess this land for themselves. If they keep His commandments, they will be blessed in this land, and no one will bother them or take away their inheritance; they will live here in safety forever.

When the time comes that they fall into unbelief, after receiving such great blessings from the Lord—having knowledge of the creation of the earth and all people, knowing the great and marvelous works of the Lord from the beginning; having been given power to do all things by faith; having all the commandments from the start, and being brought by his infinite goodness into this precious promised land—if the day comes that they reject the Holy One of Israel, the true Messiah, their Redeemer and their God, then the judgments of the just God will come upon them.
He will bring other nations to them, give those nations power, take away their lands, and cause them to be scattered and struck.
As one generation passes to another, there will be bloodshed and great calamities among them. My sons, I want you to remember and listen to my words.

I wish you would wake up—wake up from a deep sleep, even from the sleep of hell, and shake off the terrible chains that hold you, the chains that bind people and drag them away captive to the endless depths of misery and sorrow.

Wake up and get up from the dust, and listen to the words of a trembling parent, whose body you will soon lay down in the cold and silent grave, from which no one can return; in just a few more days I will go the way of all the earth.
The Lord has redeemed my soul from hell; I have seen his glory, and I am surrounded forever by the arms of his love.
I want you to remember to follow the statutes and judgments of the Lord; this has been the concern of my soul from the beginning.

My heart has been weighed down with sorrow at times, because I have feared that, because of the hardness of your hearts, the Lord your God might come in the fullness of his wrath upon you, and you could be cut off and destroyed forever.
Or, that a curse should come upon you for many generations; and you are afflicted by war and famine, are hated, and are led by the will and captivity of the devil.
My sons, I hope these things won't happen to you, but that you will be a chosen and favored people of the Lord. Let his will be done, because his ways are righteous forever.
And he has said that as long as you keep my commandments, you will prosper in the land; but if you do not keep my commandments, you will be cut off from my presence.

Now, so that I can have joy in you and leave this world with a glad heart because of you, and not go down to the grave with grief and sorrow, get up from the dust, my sons, and be men. Be determined, united in mind and heart in everything, so you won't be brought into captivity.
So that you won't be cursed with a severe curse, and so you won't bring the anger of a just God upon yourselves, leading to destruction—even the eternal destruction of both soul and body.
Wake up, my sons; put on the armor of righteousness. Shake off the chains that bind you, come out of obscurity, and rise from the dust.

Don't rebel anymore against your brother, whose insights have been inspired, and who has kept the commandments since we left Jerusalem. He has been an instrument in God's hands in leading us to the promised land. If it weren't for him, we would have died of hunger in the wilderness. Still, you tried to take his life, and he has suffered much sorrow because of you.

I am extremely afraid and trembling because of you, worried that he might suffer again; you have accused him of seeking power and authority over you, but I know he has not sought power or authority over you. He has sought the glory of God and your eternal well-being.

You have complained because he has spoken plainly to you. You say that he has been harsh; you say that he has been angry with you. But his sharpness was the power of the word of God that was in him, and what you call anger was the truth, according to what is in God, which he could not hold back, speaking boldly about your sins.
The power of God had to be with him, even to the point that he commanded you to obey. But it wasn't really him—it was the Spirit of the Lord in him that opened his mouth, so he couldn't keep silent.

Now my son Laman, and also Lemuel and Sam, and my sons who are the sons of Ishmael, if you will listen to Nephi's voice you will not perish. If you listen to him, I leave you a blessing, even my first blessing.
But if you will not listen to him, I will take away my first blessing, even my blessing, and it will rest upon him.
Now Zoram, I speak to you. You were the servant of Laban; nevertheless, you have been brought out of the land of Jerusalem, and I know that you are a true friend to my son Nephi, forever.

Because you have been faithful, your descendants will be blessed along with his descendants, so they will live in prosperity on this land for a long time. Nothing will harm or disturb their prosperity here, unless there is wickedness among them.
If you keep the commandments of the Lord, the Lord has set apart this land to ensure the safety of your descendants along with the descendants of my son.
Jacob, I'm speaking to you. You are my firstborn during my trials in the wilderness. In your childhood, you have suffered afflictions and much sorrow because of the harshness of your brothers.
Jacob, my firstborn in the wilderness, you know the greatness of God, and he will turn your afflictions to your benefit.

Your soul will be blessed, and you will live safely with your brother Nephi. Your days will be spent serving your God. I know that you are redeemed because of the righteousness of your Redeemer, for you have seen that in the fullness of time he will come to bring salvation to people.

You have seen his glory in your youth; you are blessed just like those to whom he will minister in person, because the Spirit is the same yesterday, today, and forever. The way has been prepared since the fall of man, and salvation is free.

People are taught enough to know good from evil. The law is given to them, but no one is justified by the law; instead, people are condemned by it. By the temporal law, they are cut off, and by the spiritual law, they lose what is good and become miserable forever.
Redemption comes through the Holy Messiah, because he is full of grace and truth.
He offers himself as a sacrifice for sin to fulfill the law for all who have a broken heart and a contrite spirit; and for no one else can the ends of the law be fulfilled.

It is so important to make these things known to the people of the earth, so they understand that no one can live in God's presence except through the merits, mercy, and grace of the Holy Messiah, who gives up his life in the flesh and takes it up again by the power of the Spirit, so he can bring about the resurrection of the dead, being the first to rise.
He is the first-fruits to God, because he will intercede for all the children of men; and those who believe in him will be saved.

Because of the intercession made for everyone, all people come to God and stand in his presence to be judged by him according to the truth and holiness that are in him. The purposes of the law given by the Holy One lead to the punishment that is set, and that punishment is in opposition to the happiness that is also set, to fulfill the purposes of the atonement.

There has to be opposition in all things. If not, my firstborn in the wilderness, righteousness couldn't happen, nor wickedness, nor holiness or misery, nor good or bad. So, everything would have to be combined into one; and if it were all one thing, it would remain dead, having no life or death, no corruption or incorruption, no happiness or misery, no feeling or lack of feeling.
So, it would have been created for nothing; there would have been no purpose in its creation. This would destroy the wisdom of God, his eternal purposes, and also his power, mercy, and justice.

If you say there is no law, you must also say there is no sin. If you say there is no sin, you must also say there is no righteousness. If there is no righteousness, there is no happiness. If there is no righteousness or happiness, there is no punishment or misery. If these things don't exist, there is no God. If there is no God, we do not exist, nor does the earth, because there could have been no creation—nothing to act or to be acted upon. So, everything would have disappeared.

Now, my sons, I am telling you these things for your benefit and learning; because there is a God, and he has created everything—the heavens and the earth, and everything in them, both things that act and things that are acted upon.

To accomplish his eternal purposes for humanity, after he created our first parents, the animals of the field, the birds of the air, and everything else that was created, there had to be opposition—such as the forbidden fruit in opposition to the tree of life, one being sweet and the other bitter.
So the Lord God gave people the ability to act for themselves. People couldn't act for themselves unless they were influenced by one side or the other.
I, Lehi, based on what I have read, believe that an angel of God, as it is written, fell from heaven and became a devil because he sought what was evil before God.

Because he had fallen from heaven and had become miserable forever, he also wanted all people to be miserable. So he spoke to Eve—the same serpent, who is the devil and the father of all lies—and said, "Eat the forbidden fruit, and you will not die, but you will be like God, knowing good and evil."
After Adam and Eve ate the forbidden fruit, they were sent out of the Garden of Eden to work the land.
They have had children—the family of the entire earth.

The days of the children of men were extended according to God's will so they could repent while in the flesh. Their condition became a time of probation, and their lives were lengthened according to the commandments the Lord God gave to them. He commanded that everyone must repent, because He showed everyone that they were lost due to the transgression of their parents.

If Adam had not sinned, he would not have fallen and would have stayed in the garden of Eden. Everything that was created would have stayed in the same state as when it was first made; they would have remained like that forever, without end.
And they would have had no children; they would have remained in a state of innocence, having no joy because they knew no misery, doing no good because they knew no sin.
All things have been done in the wisdom of the one who knows everything.
Adam fell so that people could exist, and people exist so they can have joy.

The Messiah comes in the fullness of time to redeem the children of men from the fall. Because they are redeemed from the fall, they have become free forever, knowing good from evil, to act for themselves and not to be acted upon, except by the punishment of the law at the great and last day, according to the commandments God has given.

People are free in their physical lives, and everything necessary for them has been given to them. They are free to choose liberty and eternal life through the great Mediator of all people, or to choose captivity and death according to the captivity and power of the devil, because he seeks to make everyone as miserable as he is.
Now, my sons, I want you to look to the great Mediator, listen to his great commandments, be faithful to his words, and choose eternal life according to the will of his Holy Spirit.

And do not choose eternal death, following the desires of the flesh and the evil within it, which gives the spirit of the devil power to capture you, to bring you down to hell, so that he can rule over you in his own kingdom.
I have spoken these few words to all of you, my sons, in the last days of my life; and I have chosen the better part, as the prophet said. My only purpose is your everlasting well-being. Amen.
Now I speak to you, Joseph, my youngest son. You were born in the wilderness during my hardships; during the time of my greatest sorrow, your mother gave birth to you.

May the Lord also dedicate this land to you, which is a very precious land, for your inheritance and the inheritance of your descendants with your brothers, for your security forever, if you keep the commandments of the Holy One of Israel.
Joseph, my youngest son, whom I brought out of the wilderness of my hardships, may the Lord bless you forever, for your descendants will not be completely destroyed.
You are the fruit of my lineage, and I am a descendant of Joseph, who was taken captive into Egypt. The Lord made great covenants with Joseph.

Joseph truly saw our day. He received a promise from the Lord that from his descendants, the Lord God would raise up a righteous branch for the house of Israel—not the Messiah, but a branch that would be separated, yet still remembered in the Lord's covenants so that the Messiah would be revealed to them in the last days, with power, to bring them out of darkness into light, out of hidden darkness and captivity into freedom.
Joseph truly testified, saying: The Lord my God will raise up a seer, who will be a choice seer for the descendants of my family.

Joseph truly said: The Lord said to me, "I will raise up a choice seer from your descendants, and he will be highly esteemed among them. I will give him a commandment to do a work for your descendants, his brothers, which will be of great value to them, bringing them to the knowledge of the covenants I have made with your fathers."
I will give him a commandment that he will do no other work except the work I command him to do. I will make him great in my eyes, because he will do my work.
He will be great like Moses, whom I said I would raise up to deliver my people, O house of Israel.
I will raise up Moses to deliver your people out of the land of Egypt.

I will raise up a seer from your descendants, and I will give him power to bring my word to your descendants—not only to bring forth my word, says the Lord, but also to convince them of my word, which will have already gone out among them.

The descendants of your family will write, and the descendants of Judah will write. What is written by your descendants and what is written by the descendants of Judah will come together to confound false doctrines, end arguments, establish peace among your descendants, and bring them to the knowledge of their ancestors in the last days, as well as to the knowledge of my covenants, says the Lord.
He will be made strong out of weakness in the day when my work begins among all my people, to restore you, O house of Israel, says the Lord.

Joseph prophesied, saying: The Lord will bless that seer, and those who try to destroy him will be confused; because this promise, which I have received from the Lord about my descendants, will be fulfilled. I am certain this promise will come to pass.

His name will be called after mine, and it will also be after his father's name. He will be like me, because the work that the Lord will accomplish through him, by the power of the Lord, will bring my people to salvation.
Joseph prophesied: I am as certain of this as I am of the promise given to Moses, because the Lord has told me, "I will preserve your descendants forever."

And the Lord has said: I will raise up a Moses, and I will give him power with a rod, and I will give him judgment in writing. But I will not loosen his tongue so that he will speak much, because I will not make him powerful in speaking. Instead, I will write my law to him with my own hand, and I will provide a spokesman for him.

And the Lord also said to me: I will raise up someone from your descendants, and I will make a spokesman for him. I will give him the ability to write the record of your descendants for your descendants, and the spokesman from your descendants will declare it.
The words he writes will be the ones that, in my wisdom, should be given to your descendants. It will be as if your descendants are calling to them from the dust, because I know their faith.
They will cry from the dust, calling their brothers to repentance, even after many generations have passed. Their message will go out, expressed in simple words.

Because of their faith, their words will come from me to their brothers, who are your descendants; and I will make the weakness of their words strong in their faith, so they will remember the covenant I made with your fathers.
And now, my son Joseph, this is how my father long ago prophesied.
Because of this covenant, you are blessed; your descendants will not be destroyed, for they will listen to the words of the book.

One mighty person will rise among them, who will do much good through both words and actions, serving as an instrument in God's hands with great faith to perform mighty miracles and accomplish what is great in God's eyes, bringing about much restoration for the house of Israel and for your brothers' descendants.
Now, you are blessed, Joseph. You are young, so listen to the words of your brother Nephi, and what I have said will happen to you. Remember the words of your dying father. Amen.
Now I, Nephi, am speaking about the prophecies my father has spoken, concerning Joseph, who was taken into Egypt.
He truly prophesied about all his descendants. The prophecies he wrote are among the greatest. He prophesied about us and our future generations, and these are written on the plates of brass.

After my father finished speaking about the prophecies of Joseph, he called the children of Laman—his sons and daughters—and said to them, "My sons and daughters, who are the children of my firstborn, I want you to listen to my words."
The Lord God has said: As long as you keep my commandments, you will prosper in the land; but if you do not keep my commandments, you will be cut off from my presence.
My sons and my daughters, I cannot go to my grave without leaving a blessing on you; because I know that if you are raised in the way you should go, you will not turn away from it.
If you are cursed, I leave my blessing with you so that the curse can be taken from you and placed on your parents instead.
Because of my blessing, the Lord God will not allow you to perish; he will be merciful to you and to your descendants forever.
After my father finished speaking to the sons and daughters of Laman, he had the sons and daughters of Lemuel brought before him.

He spoke to them, saying: My sons and my daughters, who are the children of my second son, I give you the same blessing that I gave to the sons and daughters of Laman. You will not be completely destroyed, but in the end your descendants will be blessed.
When my father finished speaking to them, he spoke to the sons of Ishmael and to all his household.

After he finished speaking to them, he spoke to Sam, saying: You and your descendants are blessed, for you will inherit the land just like your brother Nephi. Your descendants will be counted with his descendants; you will be like your brother, and your descendants will be like his descendants; and you will be blessed all your days.
After my father, Lehi, spoke to all his household according to the feelings of his heart and the Spirit of the Lord that was in him, he grew old. He died and was buried.
Not many days after his death, Laman, Lemuel, and the sons of Ishmael were angry with me because of the Lord's warnings.

I, Nephi, was compelled to speak to them according to his word. I had already said many things to them, as had my father before he died. Many of those things are written on my other plates, which contain a more detailed history.

I write the feelings of my soul on these, along with many of the scriptures engraved on the brass plates. My soul delights in the scriptures, and my heart thinks about them and writes them for the learning and benefit of my children.
My soul delights in the things of the Lord, and my heart continually thinks about the things I have seen and heard.

Even though the Lord has been so good to me and has shown me his great and marvelous works, my heart cries out, "O wretched man that I am!" My heart is sorrowful because of my weaknesses, and my soul is troubled because of my sins.
I feel surrounded because of the temptations and sins that so easily trouble me.
When I want to rejoice, my heart groans because of my sins; but I know whom I have trusted.
My God has been my support; he has led me through my afflictions in the wilderness, and he has preserved me on the waters of the great deep.
He has filled me with his love, even to the point that it consumes my whole being.
He has confused my enemies and made them tremble before me.
He has heard my cry during the day, and he has given me knowledge through visions at night.
During the day I have become bold in powerful prayer before Him; I have lifted my voice to heaven, and angels came down and ministered to me.
On the wings of his Spirit, my body has been carried away to extremely high mountains. My eyes have seen great things, even too great for people to understand; so I was commanded not to write them.

O then, if I have seen such great things, if the Lord in his condescension to the children of men has visited people with so much mercy, why should my heart weep and my soul remain in the valley of sorrow, and my body waste away, and my strength weaken because of my afflictions?

And why should I give in to sin because of my physical desires? Why should I allow temptations, letting the evil one have a place in my heart to destroy my peace and trouble my soul? Why am I angry because of my enemy?
Wake up, my soul! Don't be weighed down by sin anymore. Rejoice, my heart, and don't give any more room to the enemy of my soul.
Don't get angry again because of my enemies. Don't let my strength weaken because of my afflictions.
Rejoice, my heart, and pray to the Lord, saying: O Lord, I will praise you forever; my soul will rejoice in you, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
O Lord, will you redeem my soul? Will you deliver me from the hands of my enemies? Will you help me to tremble at the sight of sin?

Please keep the gates of hell closed to me, because my heart is broken and my spirit is humble. Lord, don't close the gates of your righteousness to me, so I can walk in the path of humility and stay true to the straight and narrow way.

O Lord, will you surround me with the robe of your righteousness? O Lord, will you make a way for me to escape from my enemies? Will you make my path straight before me? Please do not put a stumbling block in my way, but clear my path before me, and do not block my way, but block the ways of my enemy.

O Lord, I have trusted in you, and I will trust in you forever. I will not put my trust in human strength, because I know that anyone who trusts in human strength is cursed. Anyone who puts their trust in people or relies on human power is cursed.

I know that God will give generously to those who ask. My God will give to me if I don't ask for the wrong things; so I will lift my voice to you, I will call out to you, my God, the rock of my righteousness. My voice will always rise up to you, my rock and my everlasting God. Amen.
I, Nephi, prayed earnestly to the Lord my God because my brothers were angry with me.
Their anger toward me grew so much that they tried to take my life.

They complained about me, saying, "Our younger brother thinks he can rule over us, and we've had many problems because of him. Now let's kill him so we won't have to suffer more because of what he says. We won't let him be our leader, because we, as the older brothers, should be the ones to lead this people."
I'm not writing down everything they complained about me on these plates, but it's enough to say that they tried to take my life.
The Lord warned me, Nephi, that I should leave them and escape into the wilderness, along with everyone who wanted to go with me.

So I, Nephi, took my family, along with Zoram and his family, Sam, my older brother and his family, Jacob and Joseph, my younger brothers, my sisters, and everyone else who wanted to come with me. All those who chose to go with me were the ones who believed in the warnings and revelations of God, so they listened to what I said.
We took our tents and whatever things we could carry, and traveled in the wilderness for many days. After we had traveled for many days, we set up our tents.
My people wanted us to name the place Nephi, so we called it Nephi.
Everyone who was with me began calling themselves the people of Nephi.
We made sure to keep the judgments, statutes, and commandments of the Lord in everything, following the law of Moses.
The Lord was with us, and we prospered greatly. We planted seeds and harvested abundantly. We also began to raise flocks, herds, and all kinds of animals.
I, Nephi, also brought the records that were engraved on the brass plates, as well as the ball, or compass, which the Lord had prepared for my father, just as it is written.
We began to prosper greatly and to multiply in the land.

I, Nephi, took the sword of Laban and made many swords based on its design, so that the people now called Lamanites wouldn't come and destroy us. I knew they hated me, my children, and those who were called my people.
I taught my people to build structures and to work with all kinds of wood, iron, copper, brass, steel, gold, silver, and precious ores, which were very abundant.

I, Nephi, built a temple and made it similar to Solomon's temple, except it wasn't built with as many precious materials, because those things couldn't be found in the land, so it couldn't be exactly like Solomon's temple. But the way it was built was like Solomon's temple, and the workmanship was extremely fine.
I, Nephi, encouraged my people to be hardworking and to work with their hands.
They wanted me to be their king, but I, Nephi, wanted them to have no king. Still, I did for them what was within my power.

The words of the Lord had been fulfilled to my brothers, which he spoke about them, that I should be their ruler and teacher. So I was their ruler and teacher, according to the commandments of the Lord, until they tried to take my life.

The word of the Lord was fulfilled, which he spoke to me, saying that as long as they do not listen to your words, they will be cut off from the presence of the Lord. And they were cut off from his presence.

He caused a curse to come upon them, a severe curse, because of their sin. They had hardened their hearts against Him and became as hard as flint. Because they were once white, extremely fair, and attractive, the Lord God caused a skin of darkness to come upon them so they would not be enticing to my people.
The Lord God says: I will make them loathsome to your people unless they repent of their sins.
And the descendants of anyone who mixes with their descendants will be cursed; they will receive the same curse. The Lord said it, and it happened.
Because of the curse that was on them, they became an idle people, full of mischief and cunning, and they searched in the wilderness for wild animals to hunt.
The Lord God said to me, "They will be a scourge to your descendants, to remind them of me; and if they do not remember me and listen to my words, they will scourge them even to destruction."
I, Nephi, consecrated Jacob and Joseph to be priests and teachers over the land of my people.
We lived in a way that brought us happiness.
And thirty years had passed since we left Jerusalem.
And I, Nephi, had kept the records on the plates I made, about my people up to this point.
The Lord God said to me, "Make other plates, and you will engrave many things on them that are good in my sight, for the benefit of your people."
I, Nephi, made these plates and engraved these things on them to obey the commandments of the Lord.
I engraved what is pleasing to God. If my people are pleased with the things of God, they will be pleased with my engravings on these plates.
If my people want to know more specific details about the history of my people, they need to look at my other plates.
It's enough for me to say that forty years had passed, and we had already experienced wars and conflicts with our brothers.
These are the words of Jacob, the brother of Nephi, which he spoke to the people of Nephi:

My beloved brothers, I, Jacob, have been called by God and ordained according to his holy order, and have been consecrated by my brother Nephi, whom you look to as a king or protector and depend on for safety. You know that I have spoken to you about many things.

I am speaking to you again because I care deeply about your spiritual well-being. My concern for you is great, and you know it always has been. I have encouraged you with all diligence, taught you the words of my father, and spoken to you about everything that has been written since the creation of the world.

Now I want to talk to you about things that are happening now and things that will happen in the future. So I will read you the words of Isaiah. My brother has asked me to share these words with you. I am speaking to you for your benefit, so that you can learn and glorify the name of your God.

Now, the words I'm going to read are what Isaiah spoke about all the house of Israel; they can be compared to you, because you are part of the house of Israel. There are many things Isaiah has said that can be applied to you, because you are of the house of Israel.

These are the words: The Lord God says, I will lift up my hand to the Gentiles and set up my standard for the people. They will bring your sons in their arms, and your daughters will be carried on their shoulders.

Kings will be your caretakers, and their queens will be your nurses. They will bow down to you with their faces to the ground and lick the dust from your feet. You will know that I am the Lord, for those who wait for me will not be ashamed.
Now I, Jacob, want to talk a little about these words. The Lord has shown me that the people who were in Jerusalem, where we came from, have been killed and taken away as captives.

However, the Lord has shown me that they will return again. He has also shown me that the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, will reveal himself to them in the flesh; and after he reveals himself, they will scourge him and crucify him, just as the angel told me.
After they harden their hearts and stubbornly resist the Holy One of Israel, the judgments of the Holy One of Israel will come upon them, and the day will come when they will be struck and afflicted.

After they are driven back and forth—for this is what the angel says—many will suffer physically, but they will not be allowed to perish because of the prayers of the faithful. They will be scattered, struck, and hated. However, the Lord will show them mercy, so that when they come to know their Redeemer, they will be gathered together again to the lands of their inheritance.

The Gentiles are blessed, those whom the prophet has written about. If they repent, do not fight against Zion, and do not join that great and abominable church, they will be saved. The Lord God will fulfill his covenants that he has made with his children, and this is why the prophet has written these things.

Those who fight against Zion and the Lord's covenant people will lick the dust from their feet, and the Lord's people will not be ashamed. The Lord's people are those who wait for him; they continue to wait for the coming of the Messiah.

According to the words of the prophet, the Messiah will set himself again a second time to recover them. He will show himself to them with power and great glory, destroying their enemies when the day comes that they believe in him; and he will not destroy anyone who believes in him.
Those who do not believe in him will be destroyed by fire, by storms, by earthquakes, by bloodshed, by disease, and by famine. They will know that the Lord is God, the Holy One of Israel.
Can the prey be taken from the mighty, or can the lawful captive be set free?

This is what the Lord says: Even the captives of the powerful will be taken away, and the prey of the terrible will be rescued, because the Mighty God will deliver his covenant people. The Lord also says: I will fight against those who fight against you—

I will make those who oppress you eat their own flesh, and they will be drunk on their own blood as if it were sweet wine. Everyone will know that I, the Lord, am your Savior and Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

This is what the Lord says: Have I put you away, or have I cast you off forever? Where is the certificate of your mother's divorce? To whom have I sent you away, or to which of my creditors have I sold you? You have sold yourselves because of your sins, and your mother has been sent away because of your transgressions.

When I came, there was no one; when I called, no one answered. O house of Israel, is my hand too short to redeem, or do I have no power to deliver? At my command I dry up the sea, I turn rivers into wilderness, and their fish stink because the waters are dried up, and they die of thirst.
I cover the heavens with darkness and make sackcloth their covering.

The Lord God has given me the tongue of the learned, so I know how to speak a timely word to you, O house of Israel. When you are weary, he awakens morning by morning. He awakens my ear to hear as the learned.
The Lord God has opened my ear, and I was not rebellious, nor did I turn away.
I gave my back to those who struck me, and my cheeks to those who pulled out my hair. I did not hide my face from shame and spitting.
The Lord God will help me, so I will not be confused. I have set my face like stone, and I know I will not be ashamed.
The Lord is near and he justifies me. Who will argue with me? Let's stand together. Who is my opponent? Let him come near me, and I will strike him with the strength of my words.
The Lord God will help me. Anyone who condemns me will wear out like a piece of clothing, and moths will eat them up.
Who among you fears the Lord and obeys the voice of his servant, but walks in darkness and has no light?
All of you who start fires and surround yourselves with sparks, walk in the light of your own fire and the sparks you have kindled. This is what you will receive from me—you will lie down in sorrow.
Listen to me, you who pursue righteousness. Look to the rock from which you were cut, and to the hole of the pit from which you were dug.
Look to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave birth to you; for I called him alone and blessed him.

The Lord will comfort Zion; he will comfort all her desolate places. He will make her wilderness like Eden and her desert like the garden of the Lord. Joy and gladness will be found there, along with thanksgiving and the sound of music.
Listen to me, my people, and pay attention to me, my nation. A law will come from me, and I will make my judgment a light for the people.
My righteousness is close; my salvation has gone out, and my arm will judge the people. The islands will wait for me, and they will trust in my arm.

Look up to the heavens and look at the earth below; the heavens will disappear like smoke, and the earth will wear out like a piece of clothing, and those who live there will die in the same way. But my salvation will last forever, and my righteousness will never end.
Listen to me, you who know righteousness, you people in whose hearts I have written my law. Do not be afraid of people's criticism, and do not fear their insults.
The moth will eat them up like a garment, and the worm will eat them like wool. But my righteousness will last forever, and my salvation will continue from generation to generation.
Wake up, wake up! Put on strength, arm of the Lord; wake up as in ancient times. Aren't you the one who cut down Rahab and wounded the dragon?
Aren't you the one who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep, and made a path through the depths of the sea for those you redeemed to cross over?
So the redeemed of the Lord will return and come to Zion singing. Everlasting joy and holiness will be on their heads, and they will receive gladness and joy. Sorrow and mourning will disappear.
I am the one who comforts you. Who are you to be afraid of man, who will die, and of the son of man, who will become like grass?

You forget the Lord your maker, who has stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of the earth, and you have lived in constant fear every day because of the anger of the oppressor, as if he were about to destroy you. But where is the fury of the oppressor?
The captive exile hurries to be set free, so he won't die in the pit or run out of bread.
I am the Lord your God, whose waves roared; the Lord of Hosts is my name.
I have put my words in your mouth and have covered you with the shadow of my hand so that I may plant the heavens, lay the foundations of the earth, and say to Zion, "You are my people."
Wake up, wake up, stand up, Jerusalem, you who have drunk from the Lord's hand the cup of his anger—you have drunk the very last drops of the cup of trembling, drained completely—
And none of her sons she has raised are there to guide her; none of them take her by the hand.
These two things have happened to you—devastation and destruction, famine and sword—who will feel sorry for you, and by whom will I comfort you?
Your sons have fainted, except for these two; they lie at the head of every street. Like a wild bull caught in a net, they are filled with the anger of the Lord, the rebuke of your God.
So listen to this, you who are suffering and overwhelmed, but not with wine:

This is what your Lord, the Lord and your God, says: He pleads the cause of his people. I have taken the cup of trembling, the dregs of the cup of my fury, out of your hand. You will not drink from it again.
But I will give it to those who have afflicted you, who have said to your soul, "Bow down so we can walk over you"—and you have laid your body on the ground and as the street for them to walk over.
Wake up, wake up, put on your strength, Zion; put on your beautiful garments, Jerusalem, the holy city. From now on, the uncircumcised and the unclean will no longer enter you.
Shake yourself from the dust; get up and sit down, Jerusalem. Free yourself from the chains around your neck, captive daughter of Zion.
Now, my beloved brothers and sisters, I have read these things so you can know about the covenants the Lord has made with all the house of Israel—

He has spoken to the Jews through his holy prophets from the beginning, from generation to generation, until the time comes when they will be restored to the true church and fold of God; when they will be gathered home to the lands of their inheritance and be established in all their promised lands.
My beloved brothers, I am telling you these things so that you may rejoice and lift up your heads forever because of the blessings the Lord God will give to your children.
I know that many of you have searched diligently to understand things to come. I also know that you understand our bodies must waste away and die; however, in our bodies we will see God.

I know that you know that in the flesh he will show himself to those at Jerusalem, where we came from; because it is necessary for it to happen among them. The great Creator needs to allow himself to become subject to man in the flesh and die for everyone, so that all people might become subject to him.

Because death has come to everyone to fulfill the merciful plan of the great Creator, there must be a power of resurrection. Resurrection is necessary because of the Fall, and the Fall happened because of transgression. Because people became fallen, they were separated from the presence of the Lord.

So, there must be an infinite atonement—if it were not infinite, this corruption could not become incorruptible. The first judgment that came upon humanity would have lasted forever. If that were the case, our bodies would have died, decayed, and returned to the earth, never to rise again.

Oh, the wisdom of God, his mercy and grace! If our bodies never rose again, our spirits would have to become subject to that angel who fell from the presence of the Eternal God and became the devil, never to rise again.

Our spirits would have become like him, and we would become devils, angels to a devil, shut out from the presence of our God, and remain with the father of lies, in misery, like him; to that being who deceived our first parents, who transforms himself almost into an angel of light, and stirs up the children of men to secret combinations of murder and all kinds of secret works of darkness.
Oh, how great is the goodness of our God, who prepares a way for us to escape from the grasp of this awful monster—death and hell—which I call the death of the body and also the death of the spirit.
Because of the way God, the Holy One of Israel, provides deliverance, this physical death I've mentioned will release its dead; this death means the grave.

This spiritual death I've talked about will give up its dead; spiritual death is hell. So, death and hell must give up their dead—hell will release its captive spirits, and the grave will release its captive bodies. The bodies and spirits of people will be reunited, and this happens through the power of the resurrection of the Holy One of Israel.

How amazing is the plan of our God! The paradise of God must give up the spirits of the righteous, and the grave must give up the bodies of the righteous. The spirit and the body are reunited, and everyone becomes incorruptible and immortal, living souls with a perfect knowledge like we have in the flesh, except that our knowledge will be perfect.

We will have a perfect understanding of all our guilt, our impurity, and our nakedness; and the righteous will have a perfect understanding of their happiness and their righteousness, being clothed with purity, even with the robe of righteousness.

When all people have passed from this first death to life and have become immortal, they must appear before the judgment seat of the Holy One of Israel. Then comes the judgment, and they must be judged according to the holy judgment of God.

As surely as the Lord lives, for the Lord God has spoken it, and it is his eternal word, which cannot pass away: those who are righteous will remain righteous, and those who are filthy will remain filthy. Those who are filthy are the devil and his angels, and they will go away into everlasting fire prepared for them. Their torment is like a lake of fire and brimstone, whose flame rises forever and ever and has no end.
Oh, the greatness and justice of our God! He carries out all his words, and they have gone out from his mouth, and his law must be fulfilled.

The righteous, the saints of the Holy One of Israel, those who have believed in the Holy One of Israel, those who have endured the challenges of the world and have rejected its shame, will inherit the kingdom of God, which was prepared for them from the foundation of the world, and their joy will be full forever.

Oh, how great is the mercy of our God, the Holy One of Israel! He delivers his saints from that terrible monster—the devil, and from death and hell, and from that lake of fire and brimstone, which is endless torment.
How great is the holiness of our God! He knows all things, and there is nothing he does not know.

He comes into the world to save everyone who will listen to his voice; for he suffers the pains of all people—the pains of every living being, including men, women, and children—who are part of the family of Adam.
He allows this so that the resurrection can come to everyone, so that all people can stand before him on the great judgment day.
He commands everyone to repent and be baptized in his name, having perfect faith in the Holy One of Israel, or they cannot be saved in the kingdom of God.
If they do not repent, believe in his name, are not baptized in his name, and do not endure to the end, they will be condemned, because the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, has said it.

He has given a law, and where no law is given, there is no punishment. Where there is no punishment, there is no condemnation. Where there is no condemnation, the mercies of the Holy One of Israel have claim on them because of the atonement, for they are delivered by his power.

The atonement satisfies the demands of his justice for all those who have not been given the law, so they are delivered from that terrible monster—death, hell, the devil, and the lake of fire and brimstone, which is endless torment—and they are restored to the God who gave them life, who is the Holy One of Israel.
But sorrow awaits those who have been given the law, who have all the commandments of God like we do, and still break them and waste the days of their probation, for their situation is terrible!

Oh, that cunning plan of the evil one! How vain, weak, and foolish people are! When they become learned, they think they are wise, and they don't listen to God's counsel because they set it aside, thinking they know everything themselves. Their wisdom is foolishness and does not benefit them. They will perish.
Being educated is good if they listen to the counsel of God.

But sorrow awaits the rich, who are wealthy in worldly things. Because they are rich, they look down on the poor and persecute the meek, and their hearts are set on their treasures; so their treasure becomes their god. Their treasure will perish with them as well.
And sorrow awaits those who are deaf and refuse to listen, for they will be destroyed.
Sorrow awaits those who refuse to see, for they will also be destroyed.
Sorrow to those who are stubborn in heart, for their awareness of their sins will strike them at the last day.
Woe to the liar, for he will be cast down to hell.
Sorrow awaits the murderer who deliberately kills, for he will die.
Sorrow awaits those who commit sexual immorality, for they will be cast down to hell.
Sorrow awaits those who worship idols, for the devil of all devils takes pleasure in them.
In the end, sorrow awaits all those who die in their sins; for they will return to God, see his face, and remain in their sins.

My beloved brothers and sisters, remember how terrible it is to sin against the Holy God, and also how dangerous it is to give in to the temptations of the deceiver. Remember, being focused on worldly things leads to death, but being focused on spiritual things leads to eternal life.

My beloved brothers and sisters, listen to my words. Remember how great the Holy One of Israel is. Don't say that I have spoken harsh things against you; if you do, you will be speaking against the truth, because I have spoken the words of your Maker. I know that the words of truth are hard for all who are unclean, but the righteous are not afraid of them, because they love the truth and are not shaken.

Oh then, my beloved brothers and sisters, come to the Lord, the Holy One. Remember that his paths are righteous. The way for us is narrow, but it is a straight course before us, and the keeper of the gate is the Holy One of Israel; he does not employ any servant there, and there is no other way except through the gate, for he cannot be deceived, for the Lord God is his name.

Anyone who knocks, he will open to them. But the wise, the learned, and the rich who are prideful because of their knowledge, wisdom, and wealth—these are the people he despises. Unless they let go of these things, see themselves as fools before God, and humble themselves deeply, he will not open to them.
But the things of the wise and prudent will be hidden from them forever—that happiness which is prepared for the saints.

Oh, my beloved brothers, remember my words. I take off my garments and shake them before you. I pray to the God of my salvation that he looks at me with his all-searching eye. You will know on the last day, when everyone is judged by their works, that the God of Israel witnessed that I shook your sins from my soul, and that I stand with brightness before him, free from your blood.
My beloved brothers and sisters, turn away from your sins; break free from the chains of the one who wants to bind you; come to the God who is the rock of your salvation.

Prepare your souls for that glorious day when justice will be given to the righteous, the day of judgment, so you will not shrink back in terrible fear; so you will not perfectly remember your awful guilt and be forced to cry out: Holy, holy are your judgments, O Lord God Almighty—but I know my guilt; I broke your law, and my sins are mine; and the devil has taken me, making me a victim of his terrible misery.

My brothers, is it necessary for me to wake you up to the terrible reality of these things? Would I trouble your souls if your minds were pure? Would I speak so plainly to you about the truth if you were free from sin?
If you were holy, I would talk to you about holiness; but since you are not holy, and you see me as a teacher, it is necessary for me to teach you the consequences of sin.
