The thirty-second year ended, and at the beginning of the thirty-third year, Nephi called out to the people and preached to them about repentance and the forgiveness of sins.
I want you to remember that everyone who was brought to repentance was also baptized with water.

Nephi ordained men to this ministry so that everyone who came to them would be baptized with water as a witness and testimony before God and the people that they had repented and received forgiveness of their sins.
Many people were baptized in the beginning of this year as a sign of their repentance, and most of the year passed in this way.

According to our record, which we know is true because it was kept by a righteous man—for he truly performed many miracles in the name of Jesus; and no one could perform a miracle in the name of Jesus unless he was completely cleansed from his sins—
If this man made no mistake in counting our time, the thirty-third year had ended.
The people began to watch eagerly for the sign that the prophet Samuel the Lamanite had given—for the time when there would be darkness for three days over the land.
People started to have serious doubts and arguments among themselves, even though so many signs had been given.
In the thirty-fourth year, in the first month, on the fourth day of the month, a great storm arose—one unlike any that had ever been known in all the land.
There was a great and terrible storm, with thunder so intense that it shook the entire earth as if it were about to split apart.
There were extremely intense lightning storms, unlike anything ever seen before in the land.
The city of Zarahemla caught fire.
The city of Moroni sank into the depths of the sea, and its inhabitants drowned.
The earth was piled up over the city of Moronihah, and a great mountain formed where the city had been.
There was a great and terrible destruction in the land to the south.

But there was an even greater and more terrible destruction in the land northward, for the entire face of the land was changed because of the storm, the whirlwinds, the thunder, the lightning, and the extremely great shaking of the whole earth.
The highways were destroyed, the level roads were ruined, and many smooth places became rough.
Many great and notable cities sank, many were burned, and many were shaken until their buildings collapsed, their inhabitants were killed, and the places were left desolate.
Some cities remained, but the damage was extremely severe, and many people were killed.
Some people were carried away in the whirlwind, and no one knows where they went, except that they know they were carried away.
In this way, the entire surface of the earth was changed because of the storms, the thunder, the lightning, and the earthquakes.
The rocks were split in two; they were broken up across the whole earth, so that they were found in broken fragments, and in seams and cracks, all over the land.

When the thunder, lightning, storm, tempest, and earthquakes stopped—for they lasted for about three hours, though some said it was longer; still, all these great and terrible things happened in about three hours—there was darkness over the land.
There was thick darkness over the entire land, so much that the people who had not fallen could feel the vapor of darkness.
There was no light because of the darkness—not from candles, torches, or even fires made with their fine, extremely dry wood—so there was no light at all.
No light could be seen—no fire, no glimmer, not the sun, the moon, or the stars—because the mists of darkness covering the land were so thick.

For three days there was no light at all, and all the people mourned, howled, and wept continually. The people groaned deeply because of the darkness and the great destruction that had come upon them.

In one place, people were heard crying out, "If only we had repented before this great and terrible day, then our brothers and sisters would have been spared, and they would not have been burned in that great city Zarahemla."

In another place, people were heard crying and mourning, saying, "If only we had repented before this great and terrible day, and had not killed and stoned the prophets, and cast them out. Then our mothers, our beautiful daughters, and our children would have been spared, and would not have been buried in that great city Moronihah." The people's cries were great and terrible.
A voice was heard among all the people throughout the land, calling out:

Woe to this people; woe to the inhabitants of the whole earth unless they repent. The devil laughs, and his angels rejoice because of the deaths of the righteous sons and daughters of my people, and they have fallen because of their sins and abominations.
I have burned the great city Zarahemla with fire, along with its inhabitants.
I caused the great city Moroni to sink into the depths of the sea, and its inhabitants drowned.

I have covered the great city Moronihah with earth, along with its inhabitants, to hide their sins and abominations from my sight, so that the blood of the prophets and the saints will no longer come before me as a witness against them.
I caused the city of Gilgal to sink, and its inhabitants to be buried in the depths of the earth;

The city of Onihah and its inhabitants, the city of Mocum and its inhabitants, and the city of Jerusalem and its inhabitants—I have caused waters to rise in their place to cover their wickedness and abominations, so that the blood of the prophets and the saints will no longer come up to me against them.

The city of Gadiandi, the city of Gadiomnah, the city of Jacob, and the city of Gimgimno—I have caused all these to sink, creating hills and valleys in their place. I have buried their inhabitants deep in the earth to hide their wickedness and abominations from my presence, so that the blood of the prophets and the saints will not cry out to me against them anymore.

That great city Jacobugath, which was inhabited by the people of king Jacob, I caused to be burned with fire because of their sins and their wickedness, which was greater than all the wickedness on the whole earth, because of their secret murders and conspiracies. They destroyed the peace of my people and the government of the land, so I caused them to be burned and destroyed from before me, so the blood of the prophets and the saints would not come up to me against them anymore.

I caused the city of Laman, the city of Josh, the city of Gad, and the city of Kishkumen to be burned with fire, along with their inhabitants, because of their wickedness in casting out the prophets and stoning those I sent to tell them about their wickedness and their abominations.

Because they cast them all out so that there were no righteous people among them, I sent down fire and destroyed them, so their wickedness and abominations would be hidden from my sight, and so the blood of the prophets and saints I sent among them would not cry to me from the ground against them.
I have brought many great destructions upon this land and upon this people because of their wickedness and their abominations.
All of you who were spared because you were more righteous than the others, will you not now return to me, repent of your sins, and be converted so that I can heal you?
Truly I say to you, if you come to me you will have eternal life. My arm of mercy is extended toward you, and whoever comes, I will receive; and those who come to me are blessed.

I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God. I created the heavens and the earth, and everything in them. I was with the Father from the beginning. I am in the Father, and the Father is in me; and through me the Father has glorified his name.
I came to my own people, and they did not accept me. The scriptures about my coming are now fulfilled.

And everyone who has received me, I have given the opportunity to become the children of God; and I will do the same for all who believe in my name, for through me redemption comes, and in me the law of Moses is fulfilled.
I am the light and the life of the world. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end.
You will no longer offer the shedding of blood to me; your sacrifices and burnt offerings are finished, for I will not accept any of your sacrifices or burnt offerings.

You should offer me a broken heart and a repentant spirit as your sacrifice. Anyone who comes to me with a broken heart and a repentant spirit, I will baptize with fire and with the Holy Ghost, just as the Lamanites were baptized with fire and with the Holy Ghost because of their faith in me at the time of their conversion, even though they didn't realize it.
I have come into the world to bring redemption, to save the world from sin.

So anyone who repents and comes to me like a little child, I will receive, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these. For them I have laid down my life and taken it up again; so repent and come to me, all the ends of the earth, and be saved.
All the people of the land heard these words and witnessed them. After these words, there was silence in the land for many hours.
The people were so astonished that they stopped mourning and crying over the loss of their loved ones who had been killed, and there was silence throughout the land for many hours.
A voice spoke again to the people, and everyone heard it and witnessed it, saying:
People of these great cities that have fallen, descendants of Jacob, who are of the house of Israel, how often I have gathered you as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and have nourished you.

And again, how often would I have gathered you like a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, O people of the house of Israel who have fallen; O people of the house of Israel, you who live at Jerusalem and have fallen; how often would I have gathered you like a hen gathers her chicks, and you would not allow it.
O house of Israel whom I have spared, how often I will gather you as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, if you will repent and return to me with full purpose of heart.
But if not, O house of Israel, your homes will become desolate until the covenant made with your fathers is fulfilled.
After the people heard these words, they began to weep and cry again because they had lost their family and friends.

The three days passed. In the morning, the darkness disappeared from the land, the earth stopped shaking, the rocks stopped breaking apart, the terrible groanings ended, and all the loud noises faded away.

The earth came back together so that it stood firm, and the mourning, weeping, and wailing of the people who survived stopped. Their sorrow turned into joy, and their cries became praise and thanksgiving to the Lord Jesus Christ, their Redeemer.
Up to this point, the scriptures that the prophets had spoken were fulfilled.
The more righteous part of the people were saved; they were the ones who accepted the prophets and did not stone them, and they had not shed the blood of the saints—they were spared.

They were spared and were not sunk or buried in the earth; they were not drowned in the depths of the sea; they were not burned by fire, nor were they crushed to death; they were not carried away by the whirlwind, nor were they overcome by the vapor of smoke and darkness.

Now, whoever reads this, let them understand; whoever has the scriptures, let them search them and see if all these deaths and destructions by fire, smoke, tempests, whirlwinds, and the opening of the earth to receive them are not the fulfillment of the prophecies of many of the holy prophets.
I tell you, many have testified of these things at the coming of Christ, and were killed because they testified of them.
The prophet Zenos testified of these things, and Zenock also spoke about them, because they specifically testified about us, who are the remnant of their descendants.

Our father Jacob also testified about a remnant of Joseph's descendants. Aren't we a remnant of Joseph's descendants? And aren't these things that testify about us written on the brass plates that our father Lehi brought from Jerusalem?

At the end of the thirty-fourth year, I will show you that the people of Nephi who were spared, and also those who had been called Lamanites who were spared, received great kindness and many blessings, so much that soon after Christ ascended into heaven, he truly appeared to them—
He showed his body to them and ministered to them; an account of his ministry will be given later. For now, I will end my words.

A large crowd of the people of Nephi had gathered around the temple in the land of Bountiful. They were amazed and talking with each other, showing one another the great and marvelous change that had happened.
They were also talking about Jesus Christ, the one whose death had been signaled by the sign.

While they were talking with each other, they heard a voice as if it came from heaven. They looked around because they didn't understand the voice they heard. It wasn't a harsh voice or a loud voice, but even though it was a quiet voice, it pierced everyone who heard it to the center, so much that every part of their bodies trembled. It pierced them to the very soul and caused their hearts to burn.
Again, they heard the voice, but they didn't understand it.
A third time they heard the voice and listened carefully; they looked toward the direction of the sound and kept their eyes fixed on heaven, where the sound was coming from.
The third time, they understood the voice they heard, and it said to them:
This is my Beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased, in whom I have glorified my name—listen to him.

As they understood, they looked up again toward heaven and saw a Man coming down from heaven, dressed in a white robe. He came down and stood among them, and everyone in the crowd looked at him. They were so amazed that none of them dared to speak to each other, and they didn't know what it meant, because they thought an angel had appeared to them.
He stretched out his hand and spoke to the people, saying:
I am Jesus Christ, whom the prophets testified would come into the world.

I am the light and the life of the world; I have drunk from that bitter cup the Father has given me, and I have glorified the Father by taking upon myself the sins of the world, and I have suffered the will of the Father in all things from the beginning.

When Jesus finished speaking, the entire crowd fell to the ground, because they remembered that it had been prophesied among them that Christ would show himself to them after his ascension into heaven.
The Lord spoke to them, saying:

Get up and come to me, so you can put your hands into my side, and also feel the marks of the nails in my hands and my feet, so you will know that I am the God of Israel, and the God of the whole earth, and that I have been killed for the sins of the world.

The crowd stepped forward and put their hands into his side, and felt the prints of the nails in his hands and feet. They did this, going forward one by one until everyone had done so, and they saw with their eyes and felt with their hands, and knew for sure and testified that he was the one the prophets had written would come.
After they had all come forward and seen for themselves, they all cried out together, saying:
Hosanna! Blessed is the name of the Most High God! They fell down at the feet of Jesus and worshiped him.
He spoke to Nephi (since Nephi was among the crowd) and told him to come forward.
Nephi stood up, walked forward, bowed before the Lord, and kissed his feet.
The Lord told him to get up, so he got up and stood in front of him.
And the Lord said to him, "I give you authority to baptize these people when I have ascended into heaven again."
The Lord called others and said the same thing to them, giving them authority to baptize. He told them, "This is how you should baptize, and there should be no arguments among you."

I tell you the truth, anyone who repents of their sins because of your words and wants to be baptized in my name, you should baptize them in this way—you will go down and stand in the water, and you will baptize them in my name.
These are the words you should say, calling them by name, saying:
With the authority given to me by Jesus Christ, I baptize you in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost. Amen.
Then you will immerse them in the water, and they will come up again out of the water.
This is how you should baptize in my name; I truly tell you, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost are one; I am in the Father, and the Father is in me, and the Father and I are one.

Do as I have commanded you when you baptize. There should be no arguments among you, as there have been before; and there should be no arguments among you about the points of my doctrine, as there have been before.

Truly, truly I say to you, anyone who has the spirit of contention is not from me, but from the devil, who is the father of contention. He stirs up people's hearts to argue with anger against each other.
This is not my doctrine, to stir up people's hearts with anger against each other; my doctrine is that such things should be done away.
Truly, I say to you, I will tell you my doctrine.

This is my doctrine, the doctrine the Father has given me. I testify of the Father, and the Father testifies of me, and the Holy Ghost testifies of the Father and me. I testify that the Father commands everyone, everywhere, to repent and believe in me.
Anyone who believes in me and is baptized will be saved; they are the ones who will inherit the kingdom of God.
Anyone who does not believe in me and is not baptized will be condemned.

Truly, truly, I tell you, this is my doctrine, and I testify of it from the Father. Whoever believes in me also believes in the Father, and the Father will testify of me to that person, for he will visit them with fire and with the Holy Ghost.
In this way, the Father will testify of me, and the Holy Ghost will testify to him of the Father and me; because the Father, I, and the Holy Ghost are one.
I tell you again, you must repent, become like a little child, and be baptized in my name, or you cannot receive these things.
I tell you again, you must repent, be baptized in my name, and become like a little child, or you cannot inherit the kingdom of God.
Truly, truly, I say to you, this is my doctrine, and whoever builds on this builds on my rock, and the gates of hell will not overcome them.

And whoever teaches more or less than this and claims it as my doctrine comes from evil and is not built on my rock; instead, he builds on a sandy foundation, and the gates of hell are open to receive such people when the floods come and the winds beat against them.
So go to these people and share the words I have spoken, to the ends of the earth.

After Jesus finished speaking to Nephi and the others who had been called—there were twelve in total who had received power and authority to baptize—he stretched out his hand to the crowd and said, "You are blessed if you listen to the words of these twelve I have chosen from among you to serve and minister to you. I have given them power to baptize you with water. After you are baptized with water, I will baptize you with fire and the Holy Ghost. You are blessed if you believe in me and are baptized after you have seen me and know that I am."

Those who believe your words because you testify that you have seen me and know that I exist are even more blessed. Blessed are those who believe your words, humble themselves deeply, and are baptized, for they will be visited with fire and with the Holy Ghost and will receive forgiveness of their sins.
Blessed are those who are poor in spirit who come to me, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
Blessed are all who mourn, for they will be comforted.
Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
Blessed are all who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled with the Holy Ghost.
Blessed are those who are merciful, for they will receive mercy.
Blessed are all who are pure in heart, for they will see God.
Blessed are all the peacemakers, for they will be called the children of God.
Blessed are all who are persecuted because of me, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
You are blessed when people insult you, persecute you, and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of me.
You will have great joy and be extremely glad, because your reward in heaven will be great. They persecuted the prophets who came before you in the same way.

Truly, I tell you, I have made you the salt of the earth; but if the salt loses its flavor, how will the earth be salted? The salt will be good for nothing, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by people.
I tell you the truth, I have made you to be the light for these people. A city built on a hill cannot be hidden.
Do people light a candle and put it under a basket? No, they put it on a candlestick, and it gives light to everyone in the house.
Let your light shine before these people so they can see your good works and give glory to your Father in heaven.
Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets. I have not come to destroy, but to fulfill.
Truly I tell you, not one jot or tittle has passed away from the law, but in me it has all been fulfilled.

I have given you the law and the commandments of my Father, so that you will believe in me, repent of your sins, and come to me with a broken heart and a contrite spirit. You have the commandments before you, and the law is fulfilled.
So come to me and be saved; because I tell you the truth, unless you keep the commandments I have given you now, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.
You have heard that it was said by those in ancient times, and it is also written before you, that you should not kill, and whoever kills will be in danger of God's judgment.

But I tell you, whoever is angry with his brother will be in danger of judgment. Whoever says to his brother, "Raca, " will be in danger of the council, and whoever says, "You fool, " will be in danger of hell fire.
So if you come to me, or want to come to me, and remember that your brother has something against you—
Go to your brother and be reconciled with him first. Then come to me with full purpose of heart, and I will receive you.
Settle matters quickly with your adversary while you are with him on the way, so he doesn't turn you over and you end up being thrown into prison.
Truly, I tell you, you will not come out of there until you have paid the last senine. And while you are in prison, can you pay even one senine? Truly, I tell you, no.
It is written by those in ancient times that you shall not commit adultery.
But I tell you, anyone who looks at a woman with lust has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
I give you a commandment that you allow none of these things to enter into your heart.
It is better for you to deny yourselves these things and take up your cross than to be cast into hell.
It has been written that whoever divorces his wife should give her a certificate of divorce.
Truly, I tell you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery; and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
It is also written: Do not swear falsely, but keep the oaths you make to the Lord.
Truly, I tell you, do not swear at all—not by heaven, because it is God's throne.
Don't swear by the earth, because it is his footstool.
And you should not swear by your head, because you cannot make a single hair white or black.
Just let your words be "yes" or "no"; anything more than this comes from evil.
It is written: an eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.
But I say to you, do not resist evil. If anyone hits you on your right cheek, offer them the other one as well.
If anyone sues you in court to take your coat, let them have your cloak as well.
If anyone forces you to go one mile, go with him two.
Give to anyone who asks you, and don't turn away from someone who wants to borrow from you.
It is also written that you should love your neighbor and hate your enemy.
But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat and persecute you.
So you can be children of your Father in heaven, because he makes his sun rise on both the evil and the good.
So the things from ancient times, which were under the law, are all fulfilled in me.
Old things are gone, and everything has become new.
So I want you to be perfect, just as I am, or as your Father in heaven is perfect.
Truly, I tell you that I want you to give to the poor; but be careful not to do your giving in front of others just to be seen by them; otherwise you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.

So when you give to the poor, don't announce it with trumpets like the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, trying to be honored by others. I tell you the truth, they have already received their reward.
But when you give to the poor, don't let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.
So your giving may be done in secret, and your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you openly.

And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, because they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the street corners so they can be seen by others. I tell you the truth, they have their reward.
But when you pray, go into your room, and after you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you openly.
When you pray, don't use meaningless repetitions like the unbelievers do, because they think they will be heard for saying a lot of words.
So don't be like them, because your Father knows what you need before you ask Him.
Pray like this: Our Father in heaven, your name is holy.
Let your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
And forgive us our debts, as we forgive those who owe us.
And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil.
For yours is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, forever. Amen.
If you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.
But if you do not forgive others their trespasses, your Father will not forgive your trespasses.

Also, when you fast, don't be like the hypocrites with sad expressions. They make their faces look gloomy so others will see that they are fasting. I tell you the truth, they have already received their reward.
But when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face;
Don't make it obvious to others that you are fasting, but do it for your Father, who is in secret; and your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you openly.
Do not store up treasures for yourselves on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.
Instead, store up treasures for yourselves in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys, and where thieves do not break in or steal.
Your heart will be where your treasure is.
The eye is the light of the body; so if your eye is clear, your whole body will be full of light.
But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If the light within you is actually darkness, how great that darkness is!
No one can serve two masters; either they will hate one and love the other, or they will be loyal to one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and wealth.

After Jesus finished speaking, he looked at the twelve he had chosen and said to them, "Remember the words I have spoken. You are the ones I have chosen to serve this people. So I tell you, do not worry about your life—what you will eat or drink—or about your body, what you will wear. Isn't life more than food, and the body more than clothing?"
Look at the birds in the sky—they don't plant, harvest, or store food in barns, but your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you much more valuable than they are?
Who among you can add a single cubit to your height just by worrying?
And why do you worry about clothing? Think about the lilies of the field, how they grow; they don't work or make their own clothing;
I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
If God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, he will also clothe you, if you are not lacking in faith.
So don't worry, asking, "What will we eat?" or "What will we drink?" or "What will we wear?"
Your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you.
So don't worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will take care of itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
After Jesus finished speaking, he turned again to the crowd and said, "Truly, I tell you, do not judge, so that you will not be judged."
The way you judge others is how you will be judged, and the measure you use for others will be used for you.
Why do you notice the speck in your brother's eye, but don't pay attention to the beam in your own eye?
How can you say to your brother, "Let me take the speck out of your eye, " when there is a beam in your own eye?
You hypocrite, first remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck from your brother's eye.
Do not give what is holy to dogs, and do not throw your pearls before pigs, or they may trample them under their feet and then turn and attack you.
Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
Everyone who asks receives; whoever seeks finds; and to whoever knocks, it will be opened.
Which one of you, if his son asks for bread, would give him a stone?
Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a snake?
If you, who are imperfect, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him?
So, whatever you want others to do for you, do the same for them. This sums up the law and the prophets.
Enter through the narrow gate, because the gate is wide and the path is broad that leads to destruction, and many people go that way.
The gate is narrow and the path is difficult that leads to life, and few people find it.
Watch out for false prophets who come to you disguised as harmless sheep, but inside they are vicious wolves.
You will recognize them by their actions. Do people pick grapes from thorn bushes, or figs from thistles?
In the same way, every good tree produces good fruit, but a corrupt tree produces bad fruit.
A good tree cannot produce bad fruit, and a corrupt tree cannot produce good fruit.
Every tree that doesn't produce good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
So you will recognize them by their actions.
Not everyone who says to me, "Lord, Lord, " will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only those who do the will of my Father who is in heaven.
Many will say to me on that day, "Lord, Lord, didn't we prophesy in your name, and in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many wonderful works?"
Then I will tell them, "I never knew you; leave me, you who do evil."
So anyone who hears my teachings and follows them is like a wise man who built his house on a rock—
The rain fell, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, but it did not fall because it was built on a rock.
Everyone who hears my teachings and doesn't follow them will be like a foolish man who built his house on the sand—
The rain came down, the floods rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; and it collapsed, and its destruction was great.

When Jesus finished speaking, he looked around at the crowd and said to them, "You have heard the things I taught before I ascended to my Father. Whoever remembers these teachings of mine and follows them, I will raise up at the last day."

When Jesus had said these words, he noticed that some of them were amazed and wondered what he meant about the law of Moses, because they didn't understand that old things had passed away and everything had become new.
He said to them, "Don't be surprised that I told you old things have passed away and everything has become new."
I tell you that the law given to Moses is fulfilled.
I am the one who gave the law, and I am the one who made a covenant with my people Israel. The law is fulfilled in me, because I have come to fulfill the law, so it has come to an end.
I do not destroy the prophets, because everything that has not yet been fulfilled in me will all be fulfilled.
Because I told you that old things have passed away, I am not destroying what has been spoken about things that are still to come.
The covenant I made with my people isn't completely fulfilled yet, but the law given to Moses has ended in me.
I am the law and the light. Look to me and endure to the end, and you will live; for I will give eternal life to those who endure to the end.
I have given you the commandments; so keep my commandments. This is the law and the prophets, for they truly testified of me.
After Jesus finished speaking, he said to the twelve he had chosen:
You are my disciples, and you are a light to this people, who are a remnant of the house of Joseph.
This is the land of your inheritance, and the Father has given it to you.
And the Father has never given me a command to tell your brothers at Jerusalem about this.
At no time has the Father commanded me to tell them about the other tribes of the house of Israel, whom the Father has led away from the land.
The Father commanded me to tell them this:
I have other sheep that are not part of this fold; I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice. There will be one fold and one shepherd.
Because they were stubborn and didn't believe, they didn't understand my words. That's why I was commanded not to say anything more to them about the Father regarding this matter.
I tell you the truth, the Father has commanded me, and I am telling you that you were separated from them because of their sin; it is because of their sin that they do not know about you.
I tell you again, the Father has separated the other tribes from them, and because of their sin, they do not know about them.

I truly tell you, you are the ones I spoke of when I said: I have other sheep that are not of this fold; I must bring them also, and they will hear my voice, and there will be one fold and one shepherd.
They didn't understand me, because they thought I was talking about the Gentiles. They didn't realize that the Gentiles would be converted through their preaching.

They didn't understand when I said they would hear my voice; and they didn't understand that the Gentiles would never hear my voice directly—that I would not show myself to them except through the Holy Ghost.
You have both heard my voice and seen me; you are my sheep, and you are numbered among those whom the Father has given me.
I tell you truly, I have other sheep that are not from this land, nor from Jerusalem, nor from any of the surrounding areas where I have ministered.
The people I'm talking about are those who haven't heard my voice yet, and I have never shown myself to them.

But I have received a commandment from the Father to go to them, so they will hear my voice and be counted among my sheep, so there will be one flock and one shepherd. That is why I am going to show myself to them.

I command you to write down these teachings after I leave, so that if my people in Jerusalem—those who have seen me and been with me during my ministry—do not ask the Father in my name to receive a knowledge of you through the Holy Ghost, and also of the other tribes they do not know about, then these writings will be preserved and revealed to the Gentiles. Through the fullness of the Gentiles, the remnant of their descendants, who will be scattered across the earth because of their unbelief, may be gathered or brought to a knowledge of me, their Redeemer.
Then I will gather them from the four corners of the earth, and I will fulfill the covenant that the Father has made with all the people of the house of Israel.
The Gentiles are blessed because they believe in me through the Holy Ghost, which testifies to them of me and of the Father.

Because of their belief in me, says the Father, and because of your unbelief, O house of Israel, in the last days the truth will come to the Gentiles, so that the fullness of these things will be made known to them.

But sorrow awaits the unbelieving Gentiles, says the Father—for even though they have come to this land and have scattered my people of the house of Israel, my people of the house of Israel have been cast out from among them and have been trampled under their feet.

Because of the mercies of the Father to the Gentiles, and also the judgments of the Father on my people who are of the house of Israel, I truly tell you, after all this, I have caused my people who are of the house of Israel to be struck, afflicted, killed, cast out from among them, hated by them, and to become a hiss and a byword among them—

The Father commands me to tell you: When the Gentiles sin against my gospel, reject its fullness, become proud above all nations and people on earth, and are filled with all kinds of lies, deceit, mischief, hypocrisy, murders, priestcraft, sexual immorality, and secret abominations—and if they do all these things and reject the fullness of my gospel—the Father says, I will take the fullness of my gospel away from them.
Then I will remember the covenant I made with my people, O house of Israel, and I will bring my gospel to them.
I will show you, house of Israel, that the Gentiles will not have power over you. I will remember my covenant with you, house of Israel, and you will come to know the fullness of my gospel.
But if the Gentiles repent and return to me, says the Father, they will be counted among my people, O house of Israel.
I will not allow my people, who are of the house of Israel, to go among them and trample them down, says the Father.

But if they will not turn to me and listen to my voice, I will allow my people, O house of Israel, to go among them and trample them down. They will be like salt that has lost its flavor, which is then good for nothing except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot by my people, O house of Israel.
Truly, I tell you, the Father has commanded me to give this people this land as their inheritance.
Then the words of the prophet Isaiah will be fulfilled, which say:
Your watchmen will raise their voices; together they will sing, because they will see eye to eye when the Lord restores Zion.
Break out in joy and sing together, you ruined places of Jerusalem; for the Lord has comforted his people and has redeemed Jerusalem.
The Lord has revealed his holy power to all the nations, and everyone on earth will see the salvation of God.
After Jesus finished speaking, he looked around at the crowd and said to them, "My time is near."
I see that you are weak and cannot understand all the words the Father has commanded me to speak to you right now.
So go to your homes, think about the things I have said, and ask the Father in my name to help you understand. Prepare your minds for tomorrow, and I will come to you again.
But now I am going to the Father, and also to show myself to the lost tribes of Israel, because they are not lost to the Father, for he knows where he has taken them.
When Jesus had finished speaking, he looked around at the crowd and saw that they were in tears, gazing intently at him as if they wanted to ask him to stay with them a little longer.
He said to them, "I am filled with compassion for you."

Do you have anyone among you who is sick? Bring them here. Do you have anyone who is lame, blind, crippled, maimed, has leprosy, withered, deaf, or afflicted in any way? Bring them here and I will heal them, because I have compassion for you; my heart is filled with mercy.
I can see that you want me to show you what I did for your brothers and sisters in Jerusalem, and I see that your faith is strong enough for me to heal you.

After he finished speaking, the entire crowd, together, brought their sick, their afflicted, their lame, their blind, their mute, and everyone who was suffering in any way; and he healed each one as they were brought to him.

Everyone, both those who had been healed and those who were already well, bowed down at his feet and worshiped him. As many as could reach him because of the crowd kissed his feet, and they bathed his feet with their tears.
He commanded that their little children be brought to him.
They brought their little children and set them on the ground around him, and Jesus stood in the middle; the crowd moved aside until all the children had been brought to him.
When they had all been brought and Jesus stood in the middle, he told the crowd to kneel down on the ground.
When they had knelt on the ground, Jesus groaned within himself and said, "Father, I am troubled because of the wickedness of the people of the house of Israel."
After he said these words, he knelt on the ground and prayed to the Father. The things he prayed for cannot be written, but the crowd who heard him testified of it.
They testify in this way: No one has ever seen or heard such great and marvelous things as we saw and heard Jesus say to the Father.

No one can express, write, or even imagine such great and marvelous things as we saw and heard Jesus say; and no one can understand the joy that filled our hearts when we heard him pray for us to the Father.
When Jesus finished praying to the Father, he stood up; but the joy of the crowd was so great that they were overcome.
Jesus spoke to them and told them to stand up.
They got up from the ground, and he said to them, "You are blessed because of your faith. Now my joy is complete."
After he said these words, he wept, and the crowd witnessed it. He took their little children one by one, blessed them, and prayed to the Father for them.
When he finished this, he wept again.
He spoke to the crowd and said to them, "Look at your little ones."

As they looked up, they saw the heavens open and angels coming down from heaven surrounded by fire. The angels came down and surrounded the little ones, and they were encircled with fire, and the angels ministered to them.

The crowd saw and heard and testified; they know their testimony is true because each of them saw and heard for themselves. There were about two thousand five hundred people, including men, women, and children.
Jesus commanded his disciples to bring him some bread and wine.
While they went to get bread and wine, he told the crowd to sit down on the ground.
When the disciples brought bread and wine, he took the bread, broke it, blessed it, and gave it to the disciples, commanding them to eat.
After they had eaten and were full, he told them to give to the crowd.

After the crowd had eaten and were full, he said to the disciples: One among you will be ordained, and I will give him power to break bread, bless it, and give it to the people of my church—to all those who believe and are baptized in my name.
You should always do this, just as I have done—breaking bread, blessing it, and giving it to you.
Do this in remembrance of my body, which I have shown to you. It will be a testimony to the Father that you always remember me. If you always remember me, you will have my Spirit with you.
After he said these words, he told his disciples to take the wine from the cup and drink it, and to also give it to the crowd so they could drink as well.
They did as instructed, drank from it and were filled; then they gave it to the crowd, and they drank and were filled.

When the disciples had done this, Jesus said to them: You are blessed for what you have done, because this fulfills my commandments and shows the Father that you are willing to do what I have commanded you.

You should always do this for those who repent and are baptized in my name. Do it to remember my blood, which I have shed for you, so you can show the Father that you always remember me. If you always remember me, you will have my Spirit with you.
I give you a commandment to do these things. If you always do them, you are blessed, for you are built upon my rock.

But anyone among you who does more or less than these things is not built on my rock, but on a sandy foundation; and when the rain falls, the floods come, and the winds blow and beat against them, they will fall, and the gates of hell are open to receive them.
You are blessed if you keep my commandments, which the Father has commanded me to give to you.
Truly, I tell you, you must always watch and pray, so you won't be tempted by the devil and led away captive by him.
Just as I have prayed among you, you should also pray in my church, among my people who repent and are baptized in my name. I am the light; I have set an example for you.
After Jesus finished speaking these words to his disciples, he turned again to the crowd and said to them:
Truly, truly, I tell you, you must always watch and pray so you don't fall into temptation; for Satan wants to have you, so he can sift you like wheat.
So you must always pray to the Father in my name.
Whatever you ask the Father in my name, if it is right and you believe you will receive it, it will be given to you.
Pray together as families to the Father, always in my name, so that your wives and your children may be blessed.
You should meet together often, and you should not forbid anyone from coming to you when you meet. Let them come to you and do not stop them.
You should pray for them and not cast them out. If they come to you often, you should pray for them to the Father in my name.
So let your light shine for the world. I am the light you should hold up—do what you have seen me do. You have seen that I have prayed to the Father, and you have all witnessed it.

You see that I have commanded that none of you should leave, but instead I have commanded that you should come to me, so that you can feel and see; in the same way, you should do this for the world. Whoever breaks this commandment allows themselves to be led into temptation.
After Jesus finished speaking, he looked again at the disciples he had chosen and said to them:
Truly, I tell you, I am giving you another commandment, and then I must go to my Father so I can fulfill other commandments he has given me.
This is the commandment I give you: do not allow anyone to knowingly take part in my flesh and blood unworthily when you administer it.
Anyone who eats and drinks my flesh and blood unworthily brings condemnation to their soul. So if you know that someone is unworthy to eat and drink of my flesh and blood, you must not allow them.

However, you should not cast him out from among you, but you should minister to him and pray for him to the Father in my name. If he repents and is baptized in my name, then you should receive him and minister to him with my flesh and blood.
But if he does not repent, he will not be counted among my people, so that he does not destroy them. I know my sheep, and they are numbered.

However, you should not cast them out of your synagogues or places of worship, but continue to minister to them, because you do not know if they will return, repent, and come to me with full purpose of heart, and I will heal them; and you will help bring salvation to them.
So, follow these teachings I have given you so that you won't come under condemnation, because sorrow awaits anyone whom the Father condemns.
I am giving you these commandments because of the arguments that have been among you. You are blessed if you have no arguments among you.
Now I am going to the Father, because it is necessary for your sake that I go to Him.
When Jesus finished saying these things, he touched each of the disciples he had chosen, one by one, until he had touched them all, and spoke to them as he touched them.
The crowd didn't hear the words he spoke, so they didn't testify of them; but the disciples testified that he gave them power to give the Holy Ghost. I will show you later that this record is true.
When Jesus had touched them all, a cloud came and covered the crowd so they could not see Jesus.
While they were overshadowed, he left them and ascended into heaven. The disciples saw this and testified that he ascended again into heaven.
After Jesus ascended into heaven, the crowd dispersed, and everyone took his wife and children and returned to his own home.
News spread quickly among the people, even before it got dark, that the crowd had seen Jesus, that he had ministered to them, and that he would also appear to the crowd again the next day.

All night long news about Jesus spread among the people, and so many, an extremely large number, worked hard throughout the night so they could be at the place the next day where Jesus would appear to the crowd.

The next day, when the crowd was gathered together, Nephi and his brother whom he had raised from the dead, whose name was Timothy, and also his son, Jonas, as well as Mathoni, Mathonihah his brother, Kumen, Kumenonhi, Jeremiah, Shemnon, Jonas, Zedekiah, and Isaiah—these were the names of the disciples Jesus had chosen—went out and stood in the middle of the crowd.
The crowd was so large that they divided themselves into twelve groups.
The twelve taught the crowd and had them kneel on the ground and pray to the Father in the name of Jesus.
The disciples also prayed to the Father in the name of Jesus. Then they stood up and served the people.
After they shared the same words Jesus had spoken—without changing anything— they knelt again and prayed to the Father in the name of Jesus.
They prayed for what they wanted most, and they wanted to receive the Holy Ghost.
After they finished praying, they went down to the water's edge, and the crowd followed them.
Nephi went down into the water and was baptized.
He came up out of the water and started to baptize. He baptized everyone Jesus had chosen.
When they were all baptized and came up out of the water, the Holy Ghost came upon them, and they were filled with the Holy Ghost and with fire.
They were surrounded as if by fire, which came down from heaven, and the crowd saw it and testified of it. Angels also came down from heaven and ministered to them.
While the angels were ministering to the disciples, Jesus came and stood among them and ministered to them.
He spoke to the crowd and told them to kneel down again on the ground, and he also told his disciples to kneel down on the ground.
When they had all knelt down on the ground, he told his disciples to pray.
They began to pray, and they prayed to Jesus, calling him their Lord and their God.
Jesus left their midst, walked a short distance away, bowed down to the ground, and said:
Father, I thank you for giving the Holy Ghost to those I have chosen; and I have chosen them out of the world because they believe in me.
Father, I pray that you will give the Holy Ghost to all those who believe in their words.
Father, you have given them the Holy Ghost because they believe in me; and you see that they believe in me because you hear them, and they pray to me; and they pray to me because I am with them.
Now Father, I pray to you for them, and also for all those who will believe their words, that they may believe in me, so that I may be in them as you, Father, are in me, that we may be one.

When Jesus finished praying to the Father, he came to his disciples. They continued to pray to him without stopping, and they didn't use many words, because they were given what they should pray for, and they were filled with desire.

Jesus blessed them as they prayed to him; his face smiled upon them, and the light of his face shone on them. They became as white as his face and his garments, and their whiteness was greater than anything else—there could be nothing on earth as white as they were.
Jesus said to them, "Keep praying, " and they continued to pray without stopping.
He turned away from them again, went a short distance, knelt down on the ground, and prayed to the Father, saying:

Father, I thank you that you have purified those I have chosen because of their faith. I pray for them, and also for those who will believe their words, that they may be purified in me through faith in their words, just as they are purified in me.

Father, I'm not praying for the world, but for those you have given me from the world, because of their faith, that they may be purified in me, that I may be in them as you, Father, are in me, so that we may be one, and that I may be glorified in them.
After Jesus finished speaking, he returned to his disciples. They prayed to him with unwavering faith, without stopping. He smiled at them again, and they became as white as Jesus.
He went a little farther away again and prayed to the Father.
No one can express in words the things he prayed, and no one can write down the words he prayed.
The crowd heard and bore witness, and their hearts were open, and they understood in their hearts the words he prayed.
The words he prayed were so great and marvelous that they cannot be written down or spoken by anyone.

When Jesus finished praying, he came back to the disciples and said to them, "I have never seen such great faith among all the Jews; because of their unbelief, I could not show them such great miracles."
I tell you the truth, none of them have seen such great things as you have seen, nor have they heard such great things as you have heard.
He told the crowd and his disciples to stop praying out loud, but he instructed them to keep praying in their hearts.
He told them to get up and stand on their feet, and they got up and stood on their feet.
He broke bread again, blessed it, and gave it to the disciples to eat.
After they had eaten, he told them to break bread and give it to the crowd.
After they had given to the crowd, he also gave them wine to drink and told them to give it to the crowd.
There was no bread or wine brought by the disciples or by the crowd.
He truly gave them bread to eat and wine to drink.

He said to them, "Whoever eats this bread is eating my body for their soul; and whoever drinks this wine is drinking my blood for their soul; and their soul will never hunger or thirst, but will be filled."
After everyone in the crowd had eaten and drunk, they were filled with the Spirit. They all cried out together and gave glory to Jesus, whom they both saw and heard.
When they had all given glory to Jesus, he said to them, "Now I am finishing the commandment the Father has given me concerning this people, who are a remnant of the house of Israel."
You remember that I told you, when the words of Isaiah are fulfilled—and they are written, you have them in front of you—so study them.
I tell you truly, when these things are fulfilled, that is the fulfillment of the covenant the Father has made with his people, O house of Israel.

Then the remnants, who have been scattered across the earth, will be gathered from the east, west, south, and north; and they will be brought to the knowledge of the Lord their God, who has redeemed them.
And the Father has commanded me to give you this land for your inheritance.
I tell you, if the Gentiles do not repent after the blessing they receive, after they have scattered my people—

You, who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, will go among them; you will be in the midst of many people. You will be like a lion among the animals of the forest, and like a young lion among flocks of sheep, who, when he passes through, tramples down and tears apart, and no one can rescue them.
Your hand will be raised against your adversaries, and all your enemies will be cut off.
And I will gather my people together as a man gathers his sheaves onto the threshing floor.

I will make my people, with whom the Father has made a covenant, strong; I will make your horn like iron and your hooves like brass. You will break many people in pieces, and I will dedicate their wealth to the Lord, and their possessions to the Lord of all the earth. I am the one who does this.
The Father says that the sword of my justice will hang over them on that day, and unless they repent, it will fall on them, the Father says—even on all the nations of the Gentiles.
I will establish my people, O house of Israel.

I will establish this people in this land to fulfill the covenant I made with your father Jacob, and it will be a New Jerusalem. The powers of heaven will be among this people; even I will be among you.

I am the one Moses spoke about when he said, "The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own people, like me; you must listen to everything he tells you. Anyone who does not listen to that prophet will be cut off from among the people."
I tell you the truth, all the prophets from Samuel and those who came after him—everyone who has spoken—has testified of me.

You are the children of the prophets; you are of the house of Israel; you are part of the covenant that the Father made with your ancestors, saying to Abraham: In your descendants all the families of the earth will be blessed.
The Father has raised me up for you first and sent me to bless you by turning each of you away from your sins, and this is because you are the children of the covenant.

After you were blessed, the Father fulfilled the covenant he made with Abraham, saying: Through your descendants all the families of the earth will be blessed—by pouring out the Holy Ghost through me upon the Gentiles. This blessing on the Gentiles will make them mighty above all, leading to the scattering of my people, O house of Israel.

They will be a scourge to the people of this land. However, when they have received the fullness of my gospel, if they harden their hearts against me, I will bring their sins back upon their own heads, says the Father.

I will remember the covenant I have made with my people. I have promised them that I will gather them together at the right time and give them back the land of their ancestors for their inheritance—the land of Jerusalem, which is the promised land for them forever, says the Father.
The time will come when the fullness of my gospel will be preached to them.
They will believe in me, that I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and they will pray to the Father in my name.
Then their watchmen will raise their voices, and together they will sing, for they will see eye to eye.
Then the Father will gather them together again and give them Jerusalem as their land of inheritance.
Then they will break out in joy—Sing together, you ruined places of Jerusalem, for the Father has comforted his people; he has redeemed Jerusalem.
The Father has shown his holy power to all nations, and everyone on earth will see the salvation of the Father. The Father and I are one.

Then what is written will happen: Awake again and put on your strength, O Zion; put on your beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city, for from now on the uncircumcised and the unclean will no longer enter you.
Shake off the dust; get up and sit down, Jerusalem. Free yourself from the chains around your neck, captive daughter of Zion.
The Lord says: You have sold yourselves for nothing, and you will be redeemed without money.
Truly, truly, I tell you, my people will know my name; in that day they will know that I am the one who speaks.

And then they will say: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of the one who brings good news to them, who proclaims peace; who brings good news of good things, who proclaims salvation; who says to Zion: Your God reigns!
Then a call will go out: Leave, leave, go out from there; do not touch anything unclean. Go out from her midst; be clean, you who carry the vessels of the Lord.
You will not leave in a hurry or run away, because the Lord will go ahead of you, and the God of Israel will protect you from behind.
My servant will act wisely; he will be exalted, honored, and lifted very high.
Many were amazed at you—his appearance was more disfigured than any other man, and his form more than any of the sons of men—
He will sprinkle many nations; kings will be silent before him, because they will see things they were never told and think about things they had never heard.

Truly, I tell you, all these things will definitely happen, just as the Father has commanded me. Then the covenant that the Father has made with his people will be fulfilled; and Jerusalem will be inhabited again by my people, and it will be the land of their inheritance.

I truly tell you, I am giving you a sign so you will know when these things are about to happen—that I will gather my people, O house of Israel, from their long dispersion and will once again establish my Zion among them.

This is the sign I will give you: I truly tell you that when the things I am telling you now, and the things I will tell you later by myself and by the power of the Holy Ghost given to you by the Father, are made known to the Gentiles so they can learn about this people, who are a remnant of the house of Jacob, and about my people who will be scattered by them;
Truly, truly, I tell you, when these things are made known to them by the Father, and come from the Father, from them to you;

It is the Father's wisdom that they should be established in this land and set up as a free people by His power, so that these things can come from them to a remnant of your descendants, fulfilling the covenant the Father has made with His people, O house of Israel.
So, when these works and the works that will be done among you in the future come from the Gentiles to your descendants, who will fall into unbelief because of sin;

The Father wants it to come from the Gentiles so he can show his power to them. If the Gentiles do not harden their hearts, they can repent, come to me, be baptized in my name, and learn the true points of my doctrine, so they can be counted among my people, O house of Israel.
When your descendants begin to learn these things, it will be a sign to them that the work of the Father has already started to fulfill the covenant he made with the people of the house of Israel.
When that day comes, kings will be silent, because they will see things they were never told about, and they will think about things they had never heard.
On that day, for my sake, the Father will do a great and marvelous work among them; and there will be some among them who will not believe it, even though someone tells them about it.

The life of my servant will be in my hands; so they will not harm him, even though he will be damaged because of them. But I will heal him, to show them that my wisdom is greater than the cunning of the devil.

So anyone who does not believe my words—I am Jesus Christ—which the Father will cause him to bring to the Gentiles, and will give him power to deliver them to the Gentiles, will be cut off from among my covenant people, just as Moses said.

And my people, who are a remnant of Jacob, will be among the Gentiles, in the middle of them like a lion among the beasts of the forest, like a young lion among the flocks of sheep, who, if he goes through, tramples down and tears in pieces, and no one can rescue.
Their hand will be raised against their adversaries, and all their enemies will be destroyed.
Woe to the Gentiles unless they repent; for in that day, says the Father, I will remove your horses from among you, and I will destroy your chariots.
I will destroy the cities in your land and tear down all your strongholds.
I will remove witchcraft from your land, and you will have no more soothsayers.
I will also cut off your carved images and your standing images from among you, and you will no longer worship what your hands have made.
I will remove your groves from among you, and I will destroy your cities.
All lies, deceptions, envy, strife, priestcraft, and sexual immorality will be done away with.
The Father says that at that time, anyone who does not repent and come to my Beloved Son will be cut off from among my people, O house of Israel.
I will carry out vengeance and fury on them, just as I have on the nations, in a way they have never experienced before.

But if they will repent and listen to my words, and do not harden their hearts, I will establish my church among them, and they will enter into the covenant and be counted among the remnant of Jacob, to whom I have given this land for their inheritance.
They will help my people, the remnant of Jacob, and everyone from the house of Israel who comes, so they can build a city called the New Jerusalem.
At that time, they will help my people, who are scattered across the land, to be gathered into the New Jerusalem.
Then the power of heaven will come down among them, and I will also be in their midst.

At that time, the work of the Father will begin, when this gospel is preached among the remnant of this people. Truly, I tell you, on that day the work of the Father will begin among all the scattered people, even the tribes that have been lost, whom the Father has led away from Jerusalem.
The work will begin among all the scattered people of mine, with the Father preparing the way for them to come to me, so they can call on the Father in my name.
Then the work will begin, with the Father among all nations, to prepare the way for his people to be gathered home to the land of their inheritance.
They will go out from all nations, but they won't leave in a hurry or flee in fear, because I will go before them, says the Father, and I will be their protection behind them.

Then what is written will happen: Sing, O barren woman, you who did not give birth; break out in singing and shout for joy, you who did not go through labor, for the children of the desolate woman are more than those of the married wife, says the Lord.
Expand the space for your tent, and let them stretch out the curtains of your homes; don't hold back—make your cords longer and strengthen your stakes.
You will spread out to the right and to the left, and your descendants will inherit the Gentiles and make the deserted cities inhabited.

Do not be afraid, for you will not be ashamed; do not be discouraged, for you will not be put to shame. You will forget the shame of your youth and will no longer remember the disgrace of your widowhood.
Your maker, your husband, the Lord of Hosts is his name; and your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel—he will be called the God of the whole earth.
The Lord has called you like a woman who has been abandoned and is grieving in spirit, like a wife married young who was rejected, says your God.
I have left you for a short time, but with great mercy I will gather you back.
For a short time, in my anger, I hid my face from you, but with everlasting kindness I will have mercy on you, says the Lord, your Redeemer.
This is like the waters of Noah to me; just as I have sworn that the waters of Noah will never again cover the earth, so I have sworn that I will not be angry with you.
Even if the mountains leave and the hills disappear, my kindness will not leave you, and my covenant of peace will not be taken away, says the Lord who has mercy on you.
You who are afflicted, tossed by storms, and not comforted—I will set your stones with beautiful colors and lay your foundations with sapphires.
I will make your windows of agate, your gates of carbuncle, and all your borders of beautiful stones.
All your children will be taught by the Lord, and your children will have great peace.
You will be established in righteousness; you will be far from oppression because you will not be afraid, and far from terror because it will not come near you.
They will definitely gather together against you, but not because of me; whoever gathers against you will fall for your sake.
I have created the smith who blows the coals in the fire and makes an instrument for his work; and I have created the destroyer to bring destruction.

No weapon formed against you will succeed, and you will condemn every tongue that accuses you in judgment. This is the heritage of the Lord's servants, and their righteousness comes from me, says the Lord.
Now I say to you that you should study these things. I give you a commandment to search these things diligently, because the words of Isaiah are great.
He truly spoke about everything concerning my people, who are of the house of Israel; so he must also speak to the Gentiles.
Everything he said has happened and will happen, just as he said.
So pay attention to my words; write down the things I have told you, and at the time and in the way the Father wills, they will be given to the Gentiles.
Anyone who listens to my words, repents, and is baptized will be saved. Study the prophets, because many of them testify of these things.
After Jesus finished saying these words and explaining all the scriptures they had received, he said to them again, "There are other scriptures I want you to write that you haven't yet."
He said to Nephi, "Bring the record you have kept."
When Nephi brought the records and placed them in front of him, he looked at them and said:

I tell you the truth, I commanded my servant Samuel, the Lamanite, to testify to this people that when the Father glorified his name in me, many saints would rise from the dead, appear to many, and minister to them. And he said to them, "Wasn't it so?"
His disciples answered him and said, "Yes, Lord, Samuel did prophesy according to your words, and they were all fulfilled."
Jesus said to them, "Why haven't you written down that many saints rose and appeared to many people and ministered to them?"
Nephi remembered that this event had not been written down.
Jesus commanded that it be written, so it was recorded just as he instructed.
After Jesus had explained all the scriptures they had written, he commanded them to teach the things he had explained to them.

He told them to write the words that the Father had given to Malachi, which he would share with them. After they were written, he explained them. These are the words he spoke to them: The Father said to Malachi—"I will send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me. The Lord whom you seek will suddenly come to his temple, even the messenger of the covenant, whom you delight in. He will come, " says the Lord of Hosts.
But who can endure the day of his coming, and who can stand when he appears? For he is like a refiner's fire and like a launderer's soap.
He will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver, and he will purify the sons of Levi and cleanse them like gold and silver, so they can offer a righteous offering to the Lord.
Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasing to the Lord, just as it was in ancient times and in years past.

I will come to you for judgment and will quickly testify against sorcerers, adulterers, liars, those who cheat workers out of their wages, those who oppress widows and orphans, those who turn away strangers, and those who do not fear me, says the Lord of Hosts.
I am the Lord, I do not change; that is why you sons of Jacob are not destroyed.

Since the days of your ancestors, you have turned away from my commandments and have not kept them. Return to me, and I will return to you, says the Lord of Hosts. But you ask, "How should we return?"
Will a person rob God? Yet you have robbed me. But you ask, "How have we robbed you?" In tithes and offerings.
You are cursed because you have robbed me—this entire nation.

Bring all the tithes into the storehouse so there will be food in my house. Test me in this, says the Lord of Hosts, and see if I will not open the windows of heaven for you and pour out a blessing so great that there will not be enough room to receive it.
I will rebuke the devourer for your sake, and he will not destroy the fruits of your land. Your vine will not drop its fruit before it is ripe in the fields, says the Lord of Hosts.
All nations will call you blessed, for you will be a delightful land, says the Lord of Hosts.
The Lord says, "You have spoken strongly against me." But you ask, "What have we said against you?"
You have said, "It is pointless to serve God, and what benefit is there in keeping his commandments and walking humbly before the Lord of Hosts?"
Now we call the proud happy; those who do evil are promoted, and those who test God are even rescued.

Then those who feared the Lord often spoke with each other, and the Lord listened and heard them. A book of remembrance was written before him for those who feared the Lord and thought about his name.
They will be mine, says the Lord of Hosts, on the day when I gather my treasured people; and I will spare them as a man spares his own son who serves him.
Then you will return and see the difference between the righteous and the wicked, between the one who serves God and the one who does not serve him.

The day is coming that will burn like an oven, and all the proud and all who do wickedly will be like stubble. That coming day will burn them up, says the Lord of Hosts, and it will leave them neither root nor branch.
But for you who respect my name, the Son of Righteousness will rise with healing in his wings, and you will go out and grow up like calves kept in a stall.
You will trample the wicked, for they will be ashes under the soles of your feet on the day I do this, says the Lord of Hosts.
Remember the law of Moses, my servant, which I commanded him in Horeb for all Israel, along with the statutes and judgments.
I will send you Elijah the prophet before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the Lord.
He will turn the hearts of the fathers to their children, and the hearts of the children to their fathers, so that I do not come and strike the earth with a curse.
After Jesus finished teaching these things, he explained them to the crowd; he clarified everything for them, both important and simple.
He said, "The Father commanded me to give you these scriptures, which you didn't have with you, because in His wisdom they should be given to future generations."

He explained everything, from the beginning until the time when he would come in his glory—even everything that would happen on the earth, until the elements would melt with intense heat, and the earth would be rolled together like a scroll, and the heavens and the earth would pass away.
Even until the great and last day, when all people, all families, all nations, and all languages will stand before God to be judged for their works, whether they are good or evil—

If they are good, they will be resurrected to everlasting life; and if they are evil, they will be resurrected to damnation. These outcomes are parallel, one on one side and the other on the other, according to the mercy, justice, and holiness found in Christ, who existed before the world began.
There isn't enough space in this book to write even a hundredth part of what Jesus truly taught the people.
But the plates of Nephi contain most of the things he taught the people.

I have written these things, which are only a small part of what he taught the people. I wrote them so they can be brought again to this people from the Gentiles, according to the words Jesus has spoken.
When they have received this, which they need to have first to test their faith, and if they believe these things, then greater things will be revealed to them.
If they do not believe these things, the greater things will be withheld from them, to their condemnation.
I was about to write everything that was engraved on the plates of Nephi, but the Lord forbade it, saying, "I will test the faith of my people."
So I, Mormon, am writing the things the Lord has commanded me. Now I will finish what I have said and continue to write the things I have been commanded.
I want you to know that the Lord truly did teach the people for three days; and after that, he showed himself to them often, broke bread often, blessed it, and gave it to them.

He taught and ministered to the children of the multitude that had been mentioned, and he loosened their tongues so they spoke to their fathers about great and marvelous things, even greater than what he had revealed to the people; and he loosened their tongues so they could speak.

After he had ascended into heaven—the second time he showed himself to them—and had gone to the Father, after healing all their sick and lame, opening the eyes of the blind, unstopping the ears of the deaf, doing all kinds of cures among them, raising a man from the dead, and showing his power to them, he ascended to the Father—

The next day, the crowd gathered together, and they saw and heard these children; even babies opened their mouths and spoke marvelous things. The things they said were forbidden to be written by anyone.
The disciples whom Jesus had chosen began from that time to baptize and teach everyone who came to them; and everyone who was baptized in the name of Jesus was filled with the Holy Ghost.
Many of them saw and heard things that cannot be described and are not allowed to be written.
They taught and served each other, and they shared everything in common, with each person treating others fairly.
They did everything just as Jesus had commanded them.
Those who were baptized in the name of Jesus were called the church of Christ.

As the disciples of Jesus were traveling and preaching about the things they had heard and seen, and baptizing in the name of Jesus, the disciples gathered together and were united in sincere prayer and fasting.
Jesus appeared to them again while they were praying to the Father in his name. He came and stood among them and said, "What do you want me to give you?"
They said to him, "Lord, we want you to tell us the name we should call this church, because there are disagreements among the people about this."
The Lord said to them, "Truly, I tell you, why are the people complaining and arguing about this?"
Haven't they read the scriptures, which say you must take upon yourselves the name of Christ, which is my name? For by this name you will be called at the last day.
Anyone who takes upon themselves my name and remains faithful to the end will be saved on the last day.
So whatever you do, do it in my name; call the church in my name; and pray to the Father in my name so that he will bless the church for my sake.

How can it be my church unless it is called in my name? If a church is called in Moses' name, then it is Moses' church; or if it is called in the name of a man, then it is the church of a man. But if it is called in my name, then it is my church, if they are built upon my gospel.
I tell you the truth, you are built upon my gospel; so whatever you do, do it in my name. If you pray to the Father for the church in my name, the Father will hear you.
If the church is built on my gospel, then the Father will show his own works in it.

But if it is not built on my gospel, and is built on the works of men or the works of the devil, I tell you, they have joy in their works for a time, but eventually the end comes, and they are cut down and thrown into the fire, from which there is no return.
Their works follow them, and it is because of their works that they are cut down. So remember the things I have told you.
I have given you my gospel, and this is the gospel I have given you—that I came into the world to do the will of my Father, because my Father sent me.

My Father sent me so I could be lifted up on the cross; and after I was lifted up on the cross, I could draw all people to me, so that just as I have been lifted up by people, people will also be lifted up by the Father to stand before me and be judged for their works, whether they are good or evil.
This is why I have been lifted up. By the power of the Father, I will draw everyone to me so they can be judged according to their works.
